Under the Treasury regulations, an investment will be considered to jeopardize the carrying out of the exempt purposes of a private foundation if it is determined that the foundation managers, in making the investment, have failed to exercise ordinary business care and prudence, under the facts and circumstances prevailing at the time of making the investment, in providing for the long- and short-term financial needs of the foundation to carry out its exempt purposes. In the exercise of the requisite standard of care and prudence, the foundation managers may take into account the expected return (including both income and appreciation of capital), the risks of rising and falling price levels, and the need for diversification within the investment portfolio (for example, with respect to type of security, type of industry, maturity of company, degree of risk, and potential for return). The determination whether the investment of a particular amount jeopardizes the carrying out of the exempt purposes of a foundation shall be made on an investment-by-investment basis, in each case taking into account the foundation's portfolio as a whole.1
<footnote>
<footnote.reference>17</footnote.reference>
<footnote.body>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|19|31:19">
<para.text>
<st>26 C.F.R. &sect;53.4944-1(a)(2)(i)</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
</footnote.body>
</footnote> The tax can rise to 25% on the foundation, with an additional 5% on the manager.1
<footnote>
<footnote.reference>18</footnote.reference>
<footnote.body>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|19|31:19">
<para.text>
<st>26 U.S.C.A. &sect;4944(b)</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
</footnote.body>
</footnote> Assets related to the exempt purpose of the organization are not included as a jeopardy investment even if no income or appreciation is expected.1
<footnote>
<footnote.reference>19</footnote.reference>
<footnote.body>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|19|31:19">
<para.text>
<st>26 U.S.C.A. &sect;4944(c)</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
</footnote.body>
</footnote> An example is land and building for a church.
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|19|31:19">
<para.text>
Legislative activities tax. A tax is imposed on expenditures made to influence legislation, to sway the outcome of an election, or to engage in a voter-registration drive.2
<footnote>
<footnote.reference>20</footnote.reference>
<footnote.body>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|19|31:19">
<para.text>
<st>26 U.S.C.A. &sect;4945(d), (e)</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text>Tax on expenditures attempting to influence legislation, <rc>Federal Tax Coordinator 2d (RIA) &dblpara;D-8004, D-8005</rc>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</footnote.body>
</footnote> The initial tax is 20%, and this can rise to 100% of the expenditure if it is not reversed.2
<footnote>
<footnote.reference>21</footnote.reference>
<footnote.body>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|19|31:19">
<para.text>
<st>26 U.S.C.A. &sect;4945(a), (b)</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
</footnote.body>
</footnote> A manager is initially taxed 5%, rising to 50%.2
<footnote>
<footnote.reference>22</footnote.reference>
<footnote.body>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|19|31:19">
<para.text>
<st>26 U.S.C.A. &sect;4945(a), (b)</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
</footnote.body>
</footnote>
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|19|31:19">
<para.text>
Prohibited grants tax. Certain grants by a foundation are subject to the same tax as that imposed on prohibited legislative activities.2
<footnote>
<footnote.reference>23</footnote.reference>
<footnote.body>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|19|31:19">
<para.text>
<st>26 U.S.C.A. &sect;4945(d)</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text>Tax on prohibited grants, <rc>Federal Tax Coordinator 2d (RIA) &dblpara;D-8009 to D-8019</rc>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</footnote.body>
</footnote> These include grants made:
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|19|31:19">
<para.text>
(1) to an individual for travel or study unless the grant is made on a nondiscriminatory basis;
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|19|31:19">
<para.text>
(2) to a private foundation unless the grantor makes sure the foundation uses the grant properly;
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|19|31:19">
<para.text>
(3) to an exempt operating foundation (discussed below) that is not subject to the duty to make sure a grant is not properly used; and
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|19|31:19">
<para.text>
(4) to anyone for a purpose other than an exempt purpose.
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|19|31:19">
<para.text>
Under New York law, an entity classified as a private foundation is required to take the acts necessary to avoid excise taxes being imposed on the corporation.2
<footnote>
<footnote.reference>24</footnote.reference>
<footnote.body>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|19|31:19">
<para.text>
<st>N-PCL &sect;406(a)</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text>Specific Requirements of the not-for-profit corporation law, see <rc>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;71</rc>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</footnote.body>
</footnote> However, there are no state taxes imposed on such transactions.
</para.text>
</para>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block>
<label>&sect;</label>
<designator>31:20</designator>
<name>Returns and reporting requirements</name>
</outline.name.block>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><tk>West's Key Number Digest, Internal Revenue &key;4045 to 4079</tk></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|20|31:20">
<para.text>
Like most charitable organizations, private foundations must file annual returns.
<footnote>
<footnote.reference>1</footnote.reference>
<footnote.body>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|20|31:20">
<para.text>
<st>26 U.S.C.A. &sect;6033(a)</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|20|31:20">
<para.text>
The tax on net investment income is returned on <st>IRS Form 990-PF</st>. All other taxes, such as those on self-dealing, undistributed income, and political expenditures, are reported on <st>IRS Form 4720</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|20|31:20">
<para.text>
For a discussion of the return requirements for exempt organizations, generally, see <x>&sect;31:12</x>.
</para.text>
</para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text>Private foundation returns, <rc>Federal Tax Coordinator 2d (RIA) &dblpara;S-2860 to S-2862</rc>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</footnote.body>
</footnote> Failure to file annual returns may result in the imposition of penalties.
<footnote>
<footnote.reference>2</footnote.reference>
<footnote.body>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|20|31:20">
<para.text>
<st>26 U.S.C.A. &sect;6652(c)(1)</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
</footnote.body>
</footnote>
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|20|31:20">
<para.text>
A private foundation is required to include in its annual return the names and addresses of foundation managers and certain additional information concerning contributions and stock holdings, an income statement, a balance sheet, a schedule of securities and other assets held by the foundation at the close of the taxable year, and a schedule of grants and contributions paid or proof for payment during the taxable year.
<footnote>
<footnote.reference>3</footnote.reference>
<footnote.body>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|20|31:20">
<para.text>
<st>26 U.S.C.A. &sect;6033(c)(1)</st>; <st>26 C.F.R. &sect;1.6033-3</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text>Private foundation returns, <rc>Federal Tax Coordinator 2d (RIA) &dblpara;S-2860 to S-2862</rc>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</footnote.body>
</footnote>
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|20|31:20">
<para.text>
It is further required that all foundations subject to the reporting requirements publish a notice as to the availability for inspection of their annual return within a statutorily specified period from the date of publication.
<footnote>
<footnote.reference>4</footnote.reference>
<footnote.body>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|20|31:20">
<para.text>
<st>26 U.S.C.A. &sect;6104(d)</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|20|31:20">
<para.text>
A copy of the notice and proof of its publication must be filed with the foundation's return. <st>26 U.S.C.A. &sect;6033(c)(2)</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text>Annual reporting by not-for-profit organizations, <rc>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;378</rc>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text>Annual reporting by charitable organizations, <rc>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Charities &sect;87</rc>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Annual financial or other reports, <rc>Am. Jur. 2d, Corporations &sect;278</rc>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</footnote.body>
</footnote> Failure to meet the public inspection requirements may result in the imposition of penalties.
<footnote>
<footnote.reference>5</footnote.reference>
<footnote.body>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|20|31:20">
<para.text>
<st>26 U.S.C.A. &sect;6652</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
</footnote.body>
</footnote> Foundation managers are additionally required to furnish copies of the annual return to such state officials at such times and under such conditions as regulations require.
<footnote>
<footnote.reference>6</footnote.reference>
<footnote.body>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|20|31:20">
<para.text>
<st>26 U.S.C.A. &sect;6033(c)(2)</st>; <st>26 C.F.R. &sect;1.6033-3</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text>Annual reporting by not-for-profit organizations, <rc>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;378</rc>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text>Annual reporting by charitable organizations, <rc>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Charities &sect;87</rc>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Annual financial or other reports, <rc>Am. Jur. 2d, Corporations &sect;278</rc>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</footnote.body>
</footnote>
</para.text>
</para>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block>
<label>&sect;</label>
<designator>31:21</designator>
<name>Qualifying for exemption from the foundation rules</name>
</outline.name.block>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><tk>West's Key Number Digest, Internal Revenue &key;4045 to 4079</tk></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|21|31:21">
<para.text>
Private foundations include all charitable organizations, other than those exempted by statute.
<footnote>
<footnote.reference>1</footnote.reference>
<footnote.body>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|21|31:21">
<para.text>
<st>26 U.S.C.A. &sect;509(a)</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|21|31:21">
<para.text>
For a definition of charitable organizations, see <x>&sect;31:2</x>.
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|21|31:21">
<para.text>
For a list of exempt organizations, see <x>&sect;31:3</x>.
</para.text>
</para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text>Presumption that exempt organization is private foundation, <rc>Federal Tax Coordinator 2d (RIA) &para;D-7200</rc>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</footnote.body>
</footnote> In determining whether to grant exemption from private foundation status under <st>Sections 509(a)(1)</st> or <st>509(a)(2)</st>, the basic consideration is whether the organization's structure, proposed programs or activities, and intended method of operation are such as to attract the type of broadly based support from the general public, public charities, and governmental units necessary to meet the organization's support requirements.
<footnote>
<footnote.reference>2</footnote.reference>
<footnote.body>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|21|31:21">
<para.text>
<st>26 C.F.R. &sect;1.509(a)-3(d)(2)</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|21|31:21">
<para.text>
The support requirements concern mainly the sources of the organization's financing. <st>26 U.S.C.A. &sect;509(d)</st>. The factors used in determining whether an organization is exempt under <st>26 U.S.C.A. &sect;509(a)(1)</st> as a “Section 170(b)(1)(A)(vi) organization” are set out in <st>26 C.F.R. &sect;1.170A-9(f)</st>. The factors in determining whether an organization is exempt under <st>26 U.S.C.A. &sect;509(a)(2)</st> are set out in <st>26 C.F.R. &sect;1.509(a)-3</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text>Churches, schools, hospitals, etc., government-supported charities, and governmental units, <rc>Federal Tax Coordinator 2d (RIA) &para;D-7203</rc>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text>Broadly supported organizations, <rc>Federal Tax Coordinator 2d (RIA) &dblpara;D-7204 et seq</rc>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text>Private foundations defined, <rc>Federal Tax Guide to Legal Forms &sect;10:101</rc>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</footnote.body>
</footnote>
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|21|31:21">
<para.text>
In addition to the sources of the organization's financing, pertinent factors in determining the character of the organization include:
<footnote>
<footnote.reference>3</footnote.reference>
<footnote.body>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|21|31:21">
<para.text>
Some different factors may be pertinent when an organization seeks to show that it is exempt under <st>Section 170(b)(1)(A)(vi)</st> and thus comes within <st>Section 509(a)(1)</st>, and when an organization seeks to establish exemption under <st>Section 509(a)(2)</st>. See <st>26 C.F.R. &dblsect;1.170A-9(f), 1.509(a)-3(d)(3)</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text>Churches, schools, hospitals, etc., government supported charities and governmental units, <rc>Federal Tax Coordinator 2d (RIA) &para;D-7203</rc>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text>Broadly supported organizations, <rc>Federal Tax Coordinator 2d (RIA) &dblpara;D-7204 et seq</rc>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text>Private foundations defined, <rc>Federal Tax Guide to Legal Forms &sect;10:101</rc>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</footnote.body>
</footnote>
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|21|31:21">
<para.text>
(1) whether the organization has or will have a governing body comprised of public officials, persons chosen by public officials, community leaders, or persons having special knowledge of a particular relevant field;
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|21|31:21">
<para.text>
(2) whether a substantial portion of the initial funding is to be provided by the general public, public charities, or government grants;
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|21|31:21">
<para.text>
(3) in the case of an organization that carries on fundraising activities, whether concrete plans have been made for solicitation of funds from the general public, whether any steps have been taken to implement such plan, whether any firm commitments have been obtained from exempt charities, and whether the organization has made any commitments to or established any working relationship with those organizations or classes of persons intended as future recipients; and
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|21|31:21">
<para.text>
(4) whether the organization is or will be required to make its services, facilities, performances, or products available to the general public on a continuing basis.
</para.text>
</para>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block>
<label>&sect;</label>
<designator>31:22</designator>
<name>Application for exemption from the foundation rules</name>
</outline.name.block>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><tk>West's Key Number Digest, Internal Revenue &key;4045 to 4079</tk></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|22|31:22">
<para.text>
To be exempt from treatment as a private foundation, a charitable organization generally must notify the IRS within certain time limits that it is applying for recognition as a charitable organization.
<footnote>
<footnote.reference>1</footnote.reference>
<footnote.body>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|22|31:22">
<para.text>
<st>26 U.S.C.A. &sect;508(a)</st>; <st>26 C.F.R. &sect;1.508-1(a)</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text>Exempt organization status, <rc>Federal Tax Coordinator 2d (RIA) Federal Tax Coordinator 2d (RIA) &para;D-7200</rc>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</footnote.body>
</footnote>
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|22|31:22">
<para.text>
This notice is normally given by filing <st>IRS Form 1023</st> or <st>1024</st> (depending on the nature of the organization) within 15 months after the end of the month in which the organization was founded.
<footnote>
<footnote.reference>3</footnote.reference>
<footnote.body>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|22|31:22">
<para.text>
<st>26 C.F.R. &sect;1.508-1(a)(2)</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|22|31:22">
<para.text>
For a discussion of filing an application, see <x>&sect;31:11</x>.
</para.text>
</para>
</footnote.body>
</footnote>
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|22|31:22">
<para.text>
Churches and associated organizations, organizations that are not private foundations and have normal gross receipts of $5000 or less, certain subordinate organizations, and other classes of organizations that the IRS determines should be excluded from the notice requirement need not file this notice but may, nevertheless, file to obtain a favorable ruling.
<footnote>
<footnote.reference>4</footnote.reference>
<footnote.body>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|22|31:22">
<para.text>
<st>26 U.S.C.A. &sect;508(c)</st>; <st>26 C.F.R. &sect;1.508-1(a)(3)</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
</footnote.body>
</footnote>
</para.text>
</para>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block>
<label>&sect;</label>
<designator>31:23</designator>
<name>Exemption from income taxation; contents of foundation's governing instrument</name>
</outline.name.block>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><tk>West's Key Number Digest, Internal Revenue &key;4045 to 4079</tk></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|23|31:23">
<para.text>
To qualify for exemption from income taxation, private foundations must include limiting provisions in their governing instruments that the organization must distribute its income in each taxable year so as to avoid any tax under <st>Internal Revenue Code Section 4942</st> and that the foundation is prohibited from operating in such manner as to incur tax liability under <st>Internal Revenue Code Section 4941(d)</st> (relating to self-dealing), <st>Internal Revenue Code Section 4943(c)</st> (relating to excess business holdings), <st>Internal Revenue Code Section 4944</st> (relating to investments which jeopardize charitable purpose), or <st>Internal Revenue Code Section 4945</st> (relating to political expenditures).
<footnote>
<footnote.reference>1</footnote.reference>
<footnote.body>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|23|31:23">
<para.text>
<st>26 U.S.C.A. &sect;508(e)</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text>Provisions required in governing instruments of private foundations, <rc>Federal Tax Coordinator 2d (RIA) &para;D-7219</rc>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text>Mandatory governing provisions for private foundations, <rc>Federal Tax Guide to Legal Forms &sect;10:103</rc>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</footnote.body>
</footnote>
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|23|31:23">
<para.text>
The regulations provide that a foundation's governing instrument will be deemed to contain these limitations if a valid state law requires the foundation to operate within these limitations.
<footnote>
<footnote.reference>2</footnote.reference>
<footnote.body>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|23|31:23">
<para.text>
<st>26 C.F.R. &sect;1.508-3(d)(1)</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
</footnote.body>
</footnote> Such a law has been passed in New York.
<footnote>
<footnote.reference>3</footnote.reference>
<footnote.body>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|23|31:23">
<para.text>
<st>N-PCL &sect;406</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text>Specific requirements of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law, see <rc>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;71</rc>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</footnote.body>
</footnote> To avoid any difficulties that might arise in the event of the repeal or invalidation of the statute, it is recommended that the governing instruments of all private foundations contain provisions conforming to Internal Revenue Code requirements, thus insuring the exempt status of the organization. However, any private foundation taking advantage of such a state statute must include in its annual return
<footnote>
<footnote.reference>4</footnote.reference>
<footnote.body>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|23|31:23">
<para.text>
 IRS Form 990-PF or IRS Form 4720, filed pursuant to <st>26 U.S.C.A. &sect;6033(a)</st>, see <st>26 C.F.R. &sect;1.6033-2</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
</footnote.body>
</footnote> a statement that it has not taken any action that would exclude it from the coverage of the statute.
<footnote>
<footnote.reference>5</footnote.reference>
<footnote.body>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|23|31:23">
<para.text>
<st>26 C.F.R. &sect;1.508-3(d)(4)(i)</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
</footnote.body>
</footnote>
</para.text>
</para>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block>
<label>&sect;</label>
<designator>31:24</designator>
<name>Termination of private foundation status</name>
</outline.name.block>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><tk>West's Key Number Digest, Internal Revenue &key;4063</tk></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|24|31:24">
<para.text>
The Internal Revenue Service may terminate an organization's status as a private foundation only if the organization has willfully and flagrantly committed or willfully repeated actions giving rise to penalty excise taxes.
<footnote>
<footnote.reference>1</footnote.reference>
<footnote.body>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|24|31:24">
<para.text>
<st>26 U.S.C.A. &sect;507(a)(2)</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text>Involuntary termination of private foundation status, <rc>Federal Tax Coordinator 2d (RIA) &para;D-7222</rc>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text>Termination of foundation, <rc>Federal Tax Guide to Legal Forms &sect;10:118</rc>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</footnote.body>
</footnote> An organization may elect to terminate the private foundation status by giving notice to the Internal Revenue Service
<footnote>
<footnote.reference>2</footnote.reference>
<footnote.body>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|24|31:24">
<para.text>
<st>26 U.S.C.A. &sect;507(a)(1), (b)(1)(B)(ii)</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text>Voluntary termination of private foundation status, <rc>Federal Tax Coordinator 2d (RIA) &dblpara;D-7220, D-7221</rc>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text>Termination of foundation, <rc>Federal Tax Guide to Legal Forms &sect;10:118</rc>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</footnote.body>
</footnote> of its intent to do so.
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|24|31:24">
<para.text>
On voluntary termination, the private foundation must file with the Internal Revenue Service a final return consisting of <st>IRS Form 990-PF</st>, if incorporated, a conformed copy of the resolution to dissolve and a certificate of dissolution issued by a court, and a list of organizations to which assets were distributed. All of the above must be signed by an officer of the foundation. In any event, the organization will be subject to a termination tax, unless the tax is abated.
<footnote>
<footnote.reference>3</footnote.reference>
<footnote.body>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|24|31:24">
<para.text>
<st>26 U.S.C.A. &sect;507(a), (g)</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text>Notification of voluntary termination of private foundation status, <rc>Federal Tax Coordinator 2d (RIA) &para;D-7221</rc>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text>Tax on termination of private foundation status, <rc>Federal Tax Coordinator 2d (RIA) &dblpara;D-7228 to D-7234</rc>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text>Termination of foundation, <rc>Federal Tax Guide to Legal Forms &sect;10:118</rc>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</footnote.body>
</footnote>
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|24|31:24">
<para.text>
The termination tax is equal to the lesser of the aggregate tax benefit, realized by the organization over the period during which it held exempt status, or the value of the foundation's net assets.
<footnote>
<footnote.reference>4</footnote.reference>
<footnote.body>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|24|31:24">
<para.text>
<st>26 U.S.C.A. &sect;507(c)</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text>Tax on termination of private foundation status, <rc>Federal Tax Coordinator 2d (RIA) &dblpara;D-7228 to D-7234</rc>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text>Termination of foundation, <rc>Federal Tax Guide to Legal Forms &sect;10:118</rc>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</footnote.body>
</footnote>
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|24|31:24">
<para.text>
With respect to involuntary termination, the tax may be abated under certain circumstances.
<footnote>
<footnote.reference>5</footnote.reference>
<footnote.body>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|24|31:24">
<para.text>
See <st>26 U.S.C.A. &sect;507(a)(2), (g)</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text>Abatement of tax on termination of private foundation status, <rc>Federal Tax Coordinator 2d (RIA) &para;D-7234</rc>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text>Termination of foundation, <rc>Federal Tax Guide to Legal Forms &sect;10:118</rc>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</footnote.body>
</footnote> With respect to voluntary termination, the tax will be abated if the organization either distributes all of its net assets to one or more publicly supported charitable organizations, which are not private foundations and which have been in continued existence for at least five years, or notifies the Internal Revenue Service that it intends to terminate its private foundation status by altering its organizational and operational structure so as to conform to the requirements for exemption for that status over a continuous five-year period.
<footnote>
<footnote.reference>6</footnote.reference>
<footnote.body>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|24|31:24">
<para.text>
<st>26 U.S.C.A. &sect;507(b)(1)(B)(i), (ii)</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|24|31:24">
<para.text>
For discussion of the organizational and operational requirements for exemption from private foundation status, see <x>&sect;31:9</x>.
</para.text>
</para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text>Abatement of tax on termination of private foundation status, <rc>Federal Tax Coordinator 2d (RIA) &para;D-7234</rc>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text>Termination of foundation, <rc>Federal Tax Guide to Legal Forms &sect;10:118</rc>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</footnote.body>
</footnote> This notice must include:
<footnote>
<footnote.reference>7</footnote.reference>
<footnote.body>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|24|31:24">
<para.text>
<st>26 C.F.R. &sect;1.507-2(b)(3)</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text>Abatement of tax on termination of private foundation status, <rc>Federal Tax Coordinator 2d (RIA) &para;D-7234</rc>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text>Termination of foundation, <rc>Federal Tax Guide to Legal Forms &sect;10:118</rc>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</footnote.body>
</footnote>
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|24|31:24">
<para.text>
(1) the name and address of the private foundation;
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|24|31:24">
<para.text>
(2) its intention to terminate its private foundation status;
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|24|31:24">
<para.text>
(3) the Code section under which it seeks classification (Section 509(a)(1) to (3));
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|24|31:24">
<para.text>
(4) if Section 509(a)(1) is applicable, the clause of Section 170(b)(1)(A) involved;
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|24|31:24">
<para.text>
(5) the date its regular taxable year begins; and
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|24|31:24">
<para.text>
(6) the date of commencement of the five-year period.
</para.text>
</para>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block>
<label>&sect;</label>
<designator>31:25</designator>
<name>Checklist<sep/> Matters to be included in certificate of incorporation of nonprofit corporation for charitable purposes</name>
</outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>CHK</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>EBL</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<check.list>
<list list.style="para">
<list.item>
<name.block>
<designator>1</designator>
</name.block>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|25|31:25">
<para.text>Name of the corporation.</para.text>
</para>
</list.item>
<list.item>
<name.block>
<designator>3</designator>
</name.block>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|25|31:25">
<para.text>The specific purpose or purposes for which the corporation is organized, it being sufficient to state that the purpose of the corporation is any purpose for which corporations may be organized under the Law as a charitable or noncharitable corporation.</para.text>
</para>
</list.item>
<list.item>
<name.block>
<designator>5</designator>
</name.block>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|25|31:25">
<para.text>If it is not formed to engage in any activity or for any purpose requiring consent or approval of any state official, department, board, agency or other body, a statement that no such consent or approval is required.</para.text>
</para>
</list.item>
<list.item>
<name.block>
<designator>7</designator>
</name.block>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|25|31:25">
<para.text>The names and addresses of the initial directors.</para.text>
</para>
</list.item>
<list.item>
<name.block>
<designator>8</designator>
</name.block>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|25|31:25">
<para.text>The duration of the corporation if it is not to be perpetual.</para.text>
</para>
</list.item>
<list.item>
<name.block>
<designator>9</designator>
</name.block>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|25|31:25">
<para.text>A designation of the Secretary of State as agent of the corporation upon whom process against it may be served and the post office address to which the Secretary of State is to mail a copy of any process against the corporation served on him or her.<trace> The corporation may include an email address to which the secretary of state shall email a notice of the fact that process against it has been electronically served upon him or her.</trace></para.text>
</para>
</list.item>
<list.item>
<name.block>
<designator>10</designator>
</name.block>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|25|31:25">
<para.text>If the corporation is to have a registered agent, his or her name and address within New York and a statement that the registered agent is to be the agent of the corporation upon whom process against it may be served.</para.text>
</para>
</list.item>
<list.item>
<name.block>
<designator>12</designator>
</name.block>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|25|31:25">
<para.text>In order to attain federal tax-exempt status and qualify as a charity for which contributions are deductible for federal income tax purposes, add:</para.text>
</para>
</list.item>
<list.item>
<name.block>
<designator>13</designator>
</name.block>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|25|31:25">
<para.text>The certificate may contain provisions not inconsistent with law:</para.text>
</para>
<list list.style="para">
<list.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(a)</designator>
</name.block>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|25|31:25">
<para.text>For the regulation of the internal affairs of the corporation, including types or classes of membership and distribution of its assets on dissolution.</para.text>
</para>
</list.item>
<list.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(b)</designator>
</name.block>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|25|31:25">
<para.text>Required by any governmental body or officer or other person or body as a condition for giving the consent or approval required for filing the certificate of incorporation.</para.text>
</para>
</list.item>
</list>
</list.item>
</list>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|25|31:25">
<para.text>
The certificate of incorporation must be entitled “Certificate of Incorporation of (Name of Corporation), Under <st>Section 402 of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law</st>” and must state the above matters.
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|25|31:25">
<para.text>
The matters that must and may be included in the certificate of incorporation for state purposes are specified by statute. See <st>N-PCL &sect;402</st>. Additional matters must be added to qualify the corporation for exemption from income taxes. <st>26 U.S.C.A. &sect;501(c)(3)</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|25|31:25">
<para.text>
For additional matters that may be contained in the certificate, see <x>&sect;31:26</x>.
</para.text>
</para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><tk>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3370 to 3375</tk></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
<item.reference.block>
<item.reference>
<name.block>
<label>Item</label>
<designator>1.</designator>
</name.block>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|25|31:25">
<para.text>
N-PCL <st>§301</st> sets out the general rules governing the requirements for corporate names for nonprofit corporations.
</para.text>
</para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text><rc>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;164 to 176</rc></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
<item.reference>
<name.block>
<label>Item</label>
<designator>3.</designator>
</name.block>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|25|31:25">
<para.text>
A corporation may be formed under the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law for any one or more of the purposes specified in the Law. See <st>N-PCL &sect;201</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|25|31:25">
<para.text>
It is not necessary to set forth in the certificate of incorporation any of the corporate powers enumerated in the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law. See <st>N-PCL &sect;202</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text><rc>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;57, 58, 421</rc></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
<item.reference>
<name.block>
<label>Item</label>
<designator>4.</designator>
</name.block>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|25|31:25">
<para.text>
Prior to its amendment, four types of not-for-profit corporations, Types A, B, C and D, were provided for under the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law. These four types have been replaced with two types, charitable and noncharitable. A corporation formed under the Law on or after July 1, 2014 will either be a charitable corporation or a noncharitable corporation. Any corporation formed for both charitable purposes and noncharitable purposes will be deemed a charitable corporation for purposes of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law. A type A not-for-profit corporation formed prior to July 1, 2014 will be deemed a noncharitable corporation. A type B or C not-for-profit corporation formed prior to July 1, 2014 will be deemed a charitable corporation. A type D not-for-profit corporation formed prior to July 1, 2014 for charitable purposes will be deemed a charitable corporation. Any other type D not-for-profit corporations formed prior to July 1, 2014 will be deemed a noncharitable corporation. <st>N-PCL &sect;201</st>. See <st>N-PCL &sect;201(b)</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
</item.reference>
<item.reference>
<name.block>
<label>Item</label>
<designator>7.</designator>
</name.block>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|25|31:25">
<para.text>
The board of directors of a not-for-profit corporation must consist of three or more directors; the initial number of directors is implied by the listing of names and addresses of the initial directors in the certificate of incorporation. Thereafter, the number (never less than three) may be fixed by the bylaws or, in the case of a corporation having members, by action of the members or of the board under the specific provisions of a bylaw allowing such action. If not otherwise fixed, the number of directors will be three. See <st>N-PCL &sect;702(a)</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text><rc>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;71</rc></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
<item.reference>
<name.block>
<label>Item</label>
<designator>9.</designator>
</name.block>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|25|31:25">
<para.text>
The Secretary of State is the agent of every domestic corporation formed under the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law (see <st>N-PCL &sect;304(a)</st>). Additionally, the certificate of incorporation must contain a designation of the Secretary of State as agent of the corporation for service of process and provide therein a post office address to which the Secretary of State can mail a copy of any process against the corporation served on the Secretary of State. <trace>The corporation may include an email address to which the secretary of state shall email a notice of the fact that process against it has been electronically served upon him or her. </trace><st>N-PCL &sect;402(a)(6)</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text><rc>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;71</rc></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text><rc>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;1062, 1063</rc></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
<item.reference>
<name.block>
<label>Item</label>
<designator>10.</designator>
</name.block>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|25|31:25">
<para.text>
A not-for-profit corporation is not required to have a registered agent, inasmuch as the statute is couched in permissive language (see <st>N-PCL &sect;305(a)</st>). In any event, however, the Secretary of State will be the agent for service of process against the corporation (see <st>N-PCL &sect;304(a)</st>) and must be designated as such in the certificate of incorporation. <st>N-PCL &sect;402(a)(7)</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|25|31:25">
<para.text>
The corporation's registered agent is the person upon whom process against the corporation may be served and who shall deliver to the corporation all process, notices, or demands received by the agent as agent for the corporation. The registered agent must be: (1) a natural person who is a resident of or has a business address in the State of New York; or (2) a domestic corporation or a foreign corporation of any type or kind formed or authorized to conduct business in the State of New York under the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law or other state statute. <st>N-PCL &sect;305(a).</st>
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|25|31:25">
<para.text>
For the procedure for serving process on a registered agent, see <st>N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corp. Law &sect;306</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|25|31:25">
<para.text>
The designation of a registered agent may be made, revoked, or changed as provided in the <st>N-PCL &sect;305(b)</st>. This means that the designation may only be made in the certificate of incorporation and that any designation (if the corporation made no designation in its original certificate of incorporation), change, or revocation must be made by amending the certificate. See <st>N-PCL &dblsect;801(b)(8), 802(c)(3)</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text><rc>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;1062, 1063</rc></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
<item.reference>
<name.block>
<label>Item</label>
<designator>11.</designator>
</name.block>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text><rc>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;58</rc></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
<item.reference>
<name.block>
<label>Item</label>
<designator>12.</designator>
</name.block>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|25|31:25">
<para.text>
A private foundation's governing instruments must: (1) contain or be reformed so that they will contain provisions limiting the organization's exempt purposes, prohibiting nonexempt activities, and dedicating its assets to exempt purposes; (2) require disposition of assets on dissolution complying with <st>26 C.F.R. &sect;1.501(c)(3)-1(b)</st>; (3) require taxable income to be distributed; and (4) prohibit the foundation from engaging in acts which render it liable for any of the excise taxes on private foundations. See <st>26 C.F.R. &sect;1.501(c)(3)-1(b)</st>; <st>I.R.C. &sect;508(e)(1)</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|25|31:25">
<para.text>
The IRS has issued sample provisions that may be inserted in governing instruments. <st>Rev. Rul. 70-270, 1970-1 C.B. 135</st>; <st>Rev. Rul. 74-368, 1974-2 C.B. 390</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Provisions required in governing instruments of private foundations, <rc>RIA Federal Tax Coordinator 2d &para;D-7219</rc></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text>Mandatory governing provisions, <rc>Federal Tax Guide to Legal Forms &sect;10:103</rc></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
<item.reference>
<name.block>
<label>Item</label>
<designator>13.</designator>
</name.block>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|25|31:25">
<para.text>
The certificate of incorporation may include any provision, not inconsistent with law, that the incorporator(s) may choose to insert: (1) for the regulation of the internal affairs of the corporation, including types or classes of membership and the distribution of assets on dissolution or final liquidation; or (2) as required by any governmental body or officer or other person or body as a condition for giving the consent or approval required for the filing of the certificate of incorporation. <st>N-PCL &sect;402(c).</st>
</para.text>
</para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text><rc>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;71, 72</rc></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
</item.reference.block>
</note.block>
</check.list>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|25|31:25">
<para.text>
A private foundation's governing instruments must: (1) contain or be reformed so that they will contain provisions limiting the organization's exempt purposes, prohibiting nonexempt activities, and dedicating its assets to exempt purposes; (2) require disposition of assets on dissolution complying with <st>26 C.F.R. &sect;1.501(c)(3)-1(b)</st>; (3) require taxable income to be distributed; and (4) prohibit the foundation from engaging in acts which render it liable for any of the excise taxes on private foundations. See <st>26 C.F.R. &sect;1.501(c)(3)-1(b)</st>; <st>I.R.C. &sect;508(e)(1)</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|25|31:25">
<para.text>
The IRS has issued sample provisions that may be inserted in governing instruments. <st>Rev. Rul. 70-270, 1970-1 C.B. 135; Rev. Rul. 74-368, 1974-2 C.B. 390.</st>
</para.text>
</para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Provisions required in governing instruments of private foundations, <rc>RIA Federal Tax Coordinator 2d &para;D-7219</rc></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text>Mandatory governing provisions, <rc>Federal Tax Guide to Legal Forms &sect;10:103</rc></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|25|31:25">
<para.text>
The certificate of incorporation may include any provision, not inconsistent with law, that the incorporator(s) may choose to insert: (1) for the regulation of the internal affairs of the corporation, including types or classes of membership and the distribution of assets on dissolution or final liquidation; or (2) as required by any governmental body or officer or other person or body as a condition for giving the consent or approval required for the filing of the certificate of incorporation. <st>N-PCL &sect;402(c).</st>
</para.text>
</para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text><rc>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;71, 72</rc></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block>
<label>&sect;</label>
<designator>31:26</designator>
<name>Checklist<sep/> Matters to be included in certificate of incorporation of nonprofit corporation for charitable purposes<sep/> Additional matters to be included</name>
</outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>CHK</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>EBL</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<check.list>
<list list.style="para">
<list.item>
<name.block>
<designator>1</designator>
</name.block>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|26|31:26">
<para.text>General limitation on powers and purposes of organization.</para.text>
</para>
<list list.style="para">
<list.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(a)</designator>
</name.block>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|26|31:26">
<para.text>Organization to operate exclusively for the exempt purpose or purposes that allow exempt status.</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|26|31:26">
<para.text>Citation of Internal Revenue Code provision allowing exempt status.</para.text>
</para>
</list.item>
<list.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(b)</designator>
</name.block>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|26|31:26">
<para.text>Engage in no substantial activities toward carrying on propaganda or otherwise influencing legislation.</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|26|31:26">
<para.text>Not intervene in any political campaign for or against any candidate for public office.</para.text>
</para>
</list.item>
<list.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(c)</designator>
</name.block>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|26|31:26">
<para.text>Make all grants and distributions in a manner and to recipients permitted by the Internal Revenue Code.</para.text>
</para>
</list.item>
<list.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(d)</designator>
</name.block>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|26|31:26">
<para.text>In all activities operate in manner to qualify for exemption.</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|26|31:26">
<para.text>Not operate in areas outside exempt functions.</para.text>
</para>
</list.item>
<list.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(e)</designator>
</name.block>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|26|31:26">
<para.text>Not fail to comply with any other Code requirement for the specific type of exempt organization formed.</para.text>
</para>
</list.item>
</list>
</list.item>
<list.item>
<name.block>
<designator>2</designator>
</name.block>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|26|31:26">
<para.text>No right of members, officers, directors, or shareholders to earnings or benefits of organization.</para.text>
</para>
<list list.style="para">
<list.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(a)</designator>
</name.block>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|26|31:26">
<para.text>Exception for reasonable compensation for actual services rendered for needs of organization.</para.text>
</para>
</list.item>
<list.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(b)</designator>
</name.block>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|26|31:26">
<para.text>No right of members to property of organization upon liquidation or dissolution.</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|26|31:26">
<para.text>Distribution to organizations qualified to receive assets under Internal Revenue Code.</para.text>
</para>
</list.item>
</list>
</list.item>
<list.item>
<name.block>
<designator>3</designator>
</name.block>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|26|31:26">
<para.text>Not engage in activities prohibited by Internal Revenue Code.</para.text>
</para>
<list list.style="para">
<list.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(a)</designator>
</name.block>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|26|31:26">
<para.text>No self-dealing resulting in taxation under Section 4941.</para.text>
</para>
</list.item>
<list.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(b)</designator>
</name.block>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|26|31:26">
<para.text>Distribute income in a manner to avoid taxation under Section 4942.</para.text>
</para>
</list.item>
<list.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(c)</designator>
</name.block>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|26|31:26">
<para.text>Divest business interests that would result in taxation under Section 4943.</para.text>
</para>
</list.item>
<list.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(d)</designator>
</name.block>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|26|31:26">
<para.text>Make no jeopardy investments prohibited by Section 4944.</para.text>
</para>
</list.item>
<list.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(e)</designator>
</name.block>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|26|31:26">
<para.text>Make no donations or take any actions to influence legislation or participate in an election that would abuse taxation under Section 4945.</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|26|31:26">
<para.text>Make all grants and distributions in a manner and to recipients permitted by Section 4945(d).</para.text>
</para>
</list.item>
</list>
</list.item>
</list>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|26|31:26">
<para.text>
See <st>I.R.S. Pub. 557, Tax-Exempt Status for Your Organization.</st>
</para.text>
</para>
</note.group>
