</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(b)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|49|31:48">
<form.text>May sign, with the Secretary or other officer duly authorized by the Board of Directors, any deeds, mortgages, bonds, contracts, or other instruments, the execution of which has been authorized by the Board of Directors, except in cases where the signing and execution or such instruments has been expressly delegated by the Board of Directors by these bylaws or to some other officer or agent of the corporation by law; and</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(c)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|49|31:48">
<form.text>Shall perform all other duties generally incident to the office of President and such other duties as may be prescribed by the Board of Directors.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<label>Section</label>
<designator>7</designator>
<name>6</name>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|49|31:48">
<form.text>In the absence of the President or in the event of the President's inability or refusal to act, the <inline.instr>__lsqb__vice president/vice presidents in order of their election__rsqb__</inline.instr> shall perform the duties of the President and, when so acting, shall have all the powers of, and be subject to all the restrictions upon the President. Any vice president shall perform such additional duties as may, from time to time, be assigned to him by the President or by the Board of Directors.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<label>Section</label>
<designator>7</designator>
<name>7</name>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|49|31:48">

<designator>(a)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|49|31:48">

</form.para>

<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(b)</designator>
</name.block>

</name.block>

</form.item>
<form.item>

<form.item>

</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<label>Section</label>
<designator>7</designator>
<name>9</name>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|49|31:48">
<form.text>The assistant treasurers and assistant secretaries, in general, shall perform such duties as may be assigned to them by the Board of Directors, the President, the Treasurer, or the Secretary of the corporation. If so required by the Board of Directors, the assistant treasurers shall give bonds for the faithful discharge of their duties in such sums and with such sureties as the Board of Directors may deem appropriate.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<label>Section</label>
<designator>8</designator>
<name>1</name>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|49|31:48">
<form.text>By majority vote of the directors in office, the Board of Directors may, by resolution duly adopted, establish one or more committees, each of which shall consist of three or more directors, which committees, to the extent provided by such resolution, shall have and exercise the authority of the Board of Directors in the management of the corporation, provided, however, that the designation of and delegation of authority to such committees shall not relieve the Board of Directors, or any director individually, of any responsibility imposed on the Board of Directors or any individual director by these bylaws or by law.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<label>Section</label>
<designator>8</designator>
<name>2</name>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|49|31:48">
<form.text>The matter of controlling, managing, investing, and disposing of the property of this corporation for the purpose of earning an income, as distinguished from applying property and funds to charitable purposes, shall be exclusively vested in a finance committee, which shall consist of <inline.instr>__lsqb__number of directors__rsqb__</inline.instr> directors, <inline.instr>__lsqb__who shall be elected by majority vote of the board of directors/[specification of other method of election__rsqb__</inline.instr>].</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<label>Section</label>
<designator>8</designator>
<name>3</name>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|49|31:48">
<form.text>Other committees not having and exercising the managerial authority of the Board of Directors may be established by resolution duly adopted by majority vote of the Board of Directors. Except as may be provided by resolution, members of committees shall be members of the corporation and shall be appointed by the President. Any member may be removed by the President whenever, in the judgment of the President, the interests of the corporation would be best served by such removal.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<label>Section</label>
<designator>8</designator>
<name>4</name>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|49|31:48">
<form.text>Each member of a committee shall continue as such until the next annual meeting of members of the corporation and until his or her successor is appointed, unless such committee shall be sooner abolished or unless such member be removed or cease to qualify as a member of the committee.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<label>Section</label>
<designator>8</designator>
<name>5</name>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|49|31:48">
<form.text>One member of each committee shall be appointed chairperson by the person or persons authorized to appoint the members of the committee.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<label>Section</label>
<designator>8</designator>
<name>6</name>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|49|31:48">
<form.text>Vacancies in the membership of any committee shall be filled by appointments made in the same manner as provided in the case of original appointments, and any member so elected shall be elected for the unexpired term of his predecessor.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<label>Section</label>
<designator>8</designator>
<name>7</name>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|49|31:48">
<form.text>Unless otherwise provided in a committee's establishing resolution, a majority of the whole committee shall constitute a quorum, and the act of a majority of members present at a meeting at which a quorum is present shall be an act of the committee.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<label>Section</label>
<designator>8</designator>
<name>8</name>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|49|31:48">
<form.text>Each committee may adopt such rules and regulations for its meetings and the conduct of its activities as it may deem appropriate, provided, however, that such rules and regulations shall be consistent with these bylaws and provided further that regular minutes of all proceedings shall be kept.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<label>Section</label>
<designator>9</designator>
<name>1</name>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|49|31:48">
<form.text>The Board of Directors may, by resolution duly adopted, authorize any officer or officers, agent, or agents of the corporation, in addition to the officers so authorized by these bylaws, to enter into any contract or to execute and deliver any instrument in the name of and on behalf of the corporation. Such authority may be general or confined to specific instances.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<label>Section</label>
<designator>9</designator>
<name>2</name>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|49|31:48">

</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(a)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|49|31:48">

</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(b)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|49|31:48">

</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(c)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|49|31:48">
<form.text>Collect and receive the income from such funds or property;</form.text>
</form.para>

<form.item>

<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|49|31:48">

</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(e)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|49|31:48">
<form.text>Enter into an agreement with any donor to continue to devote the principal or income from the donation to such particular purpose as the donor may designate and after approval of such agreement by the Board or committee devote the principal or income from that donation according to the agreement.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<label>Section</label>
<designator>9</designator>
<name>3</name>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|49|31:48">
<form.text>All funds of the corporation shall be deposited, from time to time, to the credit of the corporation in such banks, trust companies, or other depositaries as the Board of Directors may select.</form.text>

</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<label>Section</label>
<designator>9</designator>
<name>4</name>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|49|31:48">
<form.text>All checks, drafts, or orders for the payment of money, notes, or other evidences of indebtedness issued in the name of the corporation shall be signed by such officer or officers or agent or agents of the corporation and in such manner as the Board of Directors shall, from time to time, by resolution, determine. In the absence of such determination, the instruments shall be signed by the Treasurer or an assistant treasurer and countersigned by the President or a Vice President of the corporation.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<label>Section</label>
<designator>10</designator>
<name>1</name>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|49|31:48">
<form.text>The corporation shall prepare and maintain correct and complete books and records of account and shall also keep minutes of the meetings of its members, Board of Directors, and committees and shall keep at the registered or principal office a membership book giving the names and addresses of members entitled to vote. All books and records of the corporation may be inspected by any director, member, or the agent or attorney of either, or any proper person, at any reasonable time.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<label>Section</label>
<designator>10</designator>
<name>2</name>

<label>Section</label>
<designator>10</designator>
<name>4</name>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|49|31:48">
<form.text>Whenever any notice is required to be given under the provisions of the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law or under the provisions of the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws of this corporation, a waiver thereof in writing signed by the person or persons entitled to such notice, whether before or after the time stated therein, shall be deemed equivalent to the giving of such notice.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<label>Section</label>
<designator>11</designator>
<name>1</name>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|49|31:48">
<form.text>The bylaws of this corporation may be amended, repealed, or added to or new bylaws may be adopted <inline.instr>__lsqb__by the vote or written assent of [a majority/[percentage of members__rsqb__</inline.instr>%] of the members entitled to vote/by the vote of <inline.instr>__lsqb__a majority/[percentage of members constituting a quorum__rsqb__</inline.instr>%] at a meeting duly called for the purpose according to the certificate or bylaws].</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<label>Section</label>
<designator>11</designator>
<name>2</name>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|49|31:48">
<form.text>Subject to the limitations of the certificate of incorporation, these bylaws, and the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law, concerning corporate action that must be authorized or approved by the members of the corporation, the bylaws of this corporation may be amended, repealed, or added to, or new bylaws may be adopted, by a resolution of the Board of Directors.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|49|31:48">
<para.text>
Bylaws are the code or codes of rules adopted for the regulation or management of the affairs of the corporation irrespective of the name or names by which such rules are designated. <st>N-PCL &sect;102(a)(2).</st> The bylaws may be adopted by the incorporators at the organization meeting, or by the Board of Directors if the incorporators do not do so. <st>N-PCL &sect;602(a).</st> In drafting any bylaws for a charitable corporation, it should be remembered that the bylaws may contain any provision relating to the business of the corporation, the conduct of its affairs, its rights or powers, or the rights or powers of its members, directors, or officers, that are not inconsistent with statutory law or the certificate of incorporation. <st>N-PCL &sect;602(f).</st>
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|49|31:48">
<para.text>
This form is appropriate for use by any charitable corporation organized pursuant to the <st>New York Not-for-Profit Corporation Law. N-PCL &dblsect;101 et seq.</st> Included in these proposed bylaws are detailed provisions governing both membership in, and management of, the corporation. For example, provisions set forth the rights of membership and management, including detailed provisions governing the duties of corporate officers. Also, provision is made for formation of committees of directors to exercise authority delegated by the Board.
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|49|31:48">
<para.text>
It is customary to include in the articles of incorporation certain provisions to qualify an organization for tax-exempt status. Some of these provisions must be included in the articles. Inclusion of the mandatory provisions in the bylaws is not a substitute for inclusion in the basic foundation charter, whatever form it may take. On the other hand, it has become customary to include all these provisions in the bylaws, even though not required. This can be of particular importance for those matters not required to be included in the articles of organization, but which must nevertheless be covered. If they should be left out of the bylaws, problems could occur. In any event, the usual custom is to include all the mandatory tax provisions in the bylaws.
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|49|31:48">
<para.text>
For other matters that may be included in a corporation's bylaws, see <x>Corporations &dblsect;17:1 et seq.</x> and Social and Recreation Nonprofit Organizations <x>&dblsect;30:1 et seq.</x>
</para.text>
</para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><tk>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3384</tk></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
<item.reference.block>
<item.reference>
<name.block>
<label>ARTICLE</label>
<designator>TWO.</designator>
</name.block>
<item.reference>
<name.block>
<label>Section</label>
<designator>2.1.</designator>
</name.block>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|49|31:48">
<para.text>
Although these bylaws provide for only one class of members, a not-for-profit corporation is authorized to have more classes of members if so desired. Additionally, these bylaws provide that members are entitled to vote. As a consequence, the members must vote on any amendment to the certificate of incorporation. <st>N-PCL &sect;802(a)</st>. They must also vote to authorize the sale, lease, exchange, mortgage, pledge, or other disposition of all or substantially all of the property and assets of the corporation. <st>N-PCL &dblsect;509, 510</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text><rc>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;823</rc></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text><rc>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;916</rc></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
</item.reference>
<item.reference>
<name.block>
<label>ARTICLE</label>
<designator>TWO.</designator>
</name.block>
<item.reference>
<name.block>
<label>Section</label>
<designator>2.2.</designator>
</name.block>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|49|31:48">
<para.text>
Unless limited by the certificate of incorporation or bylaws, anyone may become a member of the corporation. See <st>N-PCL §601.</st>
</para.text>
</para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text><rc>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;823</rc></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
</item.reference>
<item.reference>
<name.block>
<label>ARTICLE</label>
<designator>TWO.</designator>
</name.block>
<item.reference>
<name.block>
<label>Section</label>
<designator>2.6.</designator>
</name.block>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|49|31:48">
<para.text>
These bylaws provide that membership in the corporation is nontransferable. However, the certificate of incorporation or bylaws may provide for transfer of memberships. See <st>N-PCL §601(d)</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|49|31:48">
<para.text>
Unless otherwise provided in the certificate of incorporation or bylaws, membership in a not-for-profit corporation shall be terminated by death, resignation, expulsion, expiration of a term of membership, or dissolution and liquidation under <st>Articles 10 and 11 of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law</st>. <st>N-PCL &sect;601(e)</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text><rc>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;835</rc></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
</item.reference>
<item.reference>
<name.block>
<label>ARTICLE</label>
<designator>THREE.</designator>
</name.block>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|49|31:48">
<para.text>
While these bylaws provide for the issuance of certificates of membership, it must be remembered that such certificates are not transferable and that a not-for-profit corporation is prohibited from having or issuing any shares of stock. <st>N-PCL &dblsect;501, 601(c).</st> Any certificate must state conspicuously that the corporation is a not-for-profit corporation. <st>N-PCL &sect;501.</st> No dividend may be paid and no part of its income may be distributed to its members, directors, or officers, except as authorized by statute. <st>N-PCL &sect;515.</st>
</para.text>
</para>
</item.reference>
<item.reference>
<name.block>
<label>ARTICLE</label>
<designator>FIVE.</designator>
</name.block>
<item.reference>
<name.block>
<label>Sections</label>
<designator>5.1, 5.2, 5.3.</designator>
</name.block>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|49|31:48">
<para.text>
These sections are declarative of New York law. First, in the absence of a specific provision for the place of meeting, all meetings must be held at the corporation's registered office. Next, failure to hold an annual meeting at the time and place designated in the bylaws will not work a forfeiture or dissolution of the corporation. Finally, the percentage of members necessary to call a special meeting may be specified in the bylaws or certificate of incorporation; in the event of a failure to specify such percentage, a special meeting may be called by members having 10% of the votes entitled to be cast. See <st>N-PCL &sect;603.</st>
</para.text>
</para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text><rc>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;897</rc></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text><rc>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;908</rc></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
</item.reference>

<designator>5.4.</designator>
</name.block>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|49|31:48">
<para.text>
This provision is declarative of New York law. <st>N-PCL &sect;605.</st>
</para.text>
</para>
<trace.deleted/>

<para.text>
This provision is authorized by <st>N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corp. Law &sect;614</st>.
</para.text>
</para>

<designator>5.6.</designator>
</name.block>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|49|31:48">
<para.text>
With certain limitations as to the minimum number or percentage of votes, the bylaws may make provisions as to a quorum. <st>N-PCL &dblsect;608, 615.</st>
</para.text>
</para>

</item.reference>
<item.reference>
<name.block>
<label>ARTICLE</label>
<designator>FIVE. Other Provisions.</designator>
</name.block>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|49|31:48">
<para.text>
The Not-for-Profit Corporation Law authorizes other provisions affecting members' rights, including:
</para.text>
</para>
</item.reference>
<item.reference>
<name.block>
<label>ARTICLE</label>
<designator>SIX.</designator>
</name.block>
<item.reference>
<name.block>
<label>Sections</label>
<designator>6.1, 6.2, 6.3.</designator>
</name.block>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|49|31:48">
<para.text>
There must not be less than three members of the Board of Directors; however, the number of directors may be fixed by the bylaws and increased or decreased from time to time by amendment. See <st>N-PCL &sect;702</st>. The term of office for a director, generally, cannot exceed five years. <st>N-PCL &sect;703(b)</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|49|31:48">
<para.text>
New York law apparently places no restrictions on the qualifications necessary to serve on a Board of Directors; for example, directors need not be residents of the state or members of the corporation unless the certificate or bylaws so require. See <st>N-PCL &sect;703</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text><rc>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;535</rc></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text><rc>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;537</rc></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text><rc>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;541</rc></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text><rc>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;544</rc></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
</item.reference>
<item.reference>
<name.block>
<label>ARTICLE</label>
<designator>SIX.</designator>
</name.block>
<item.reference>
<name.block>
<label>Section</label>
<designator>6.4(b)</designator>
</name.block>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|49|31:48">
<para.text>
This provision is authorized by New York law. <st>N-PCL §712.</st>
</para.text>
</para>
</item.reference>
</item.reference>
<item.reference>
<name.block>
<label>ARTICLE</label>
<designator>SIX.</designator>
</name.block>
<item.reference>
<name.block>
<label>Section</label>
<designator>6.6.</designator>
</name.block>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|49|31:48">
<para.text>
Although this provision denies compensation to the directors, reasonable compensation is authorized for services rendered. See <st>N-PCL &sect;515.</st>
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|49|31:48">
<para.text>
This provision is suggested to avoid difficulties in establishing exemption from federal income taxation.
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|49|31:48">
<para.text>
For discussion of qualifying for tax exemption, see <x>&dblsect;31:9 et seq.</x>
</para.text>
</para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text><rc>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;789</rc></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
</item.reference>
<item.reference>
<name.block>
<label>ARTICLE</label>
<designator>SIX.</designator>
</name.block>
<item.reference>
<name.block>
<label>Section</label>
<designator>6.7.</designator>
</name.block>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|49|31:48">
<para.text>
Unless otherwise provided in the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws, a majority of the entire board of directors constitutes a quorum, provided that the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws may fix the quorum at less than a majority of the entire board if, in the case of a board of 15 members or less, the quorum is at least one-third of the entire number of members, and, in the case of a board of more than 15 members, the quorum must be at least five members plus one additional member for every 10 members (or fraction thereof) in excess of 15. <st>N-PCL &sect;707</st>; <cc>Desuzia v. Board of Directors of Concourse Village, Inc., 117 A.D.3d 426, 985 N.Y.S.2d 48 (1st Dep't 2014)</cc> stating that a supermajority quorum requirement may be imposed through corporate bylaws.
</para.text>
</para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text><rc>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;605</rc></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
</item.reference>
<item.reference>
<name.block>
<label>ARTICLE</label>
<designator>SIX.</designator>
</name.block>
<item.reference>
<name.block>
<label>Section</label>
<designator>6.8.</designator>
</name.block>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|49|31:48">
<para.text>
This provision is authorized by <st>N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corp. Law &sect;708</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text><rc>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;602</rc></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
</item.reference>
<item.reference>
<name.block>
<label>ARTICLE</label>
<designator>SEVEN.</designator>
</name.block>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|49|31:48">
<para.text>
This article is declarative of New York law. See <st>N-PCL &sect;713</st>. The removal of an officer without cause must be without prejudice to his or contract rights, if any. <st>N-PCL &sect;714</st>. Additionally, any two or more offices may be held by the same person, except the offices of President and Secretary. <st>N-PCL &sect;713(a)</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text><rc>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;531</rc></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text><rc>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;5661 to 568</rc></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
<item.reference>
<name.block>
<label>ARTICLE</label>
<designator>EIGHT.</designator>
</name.block>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|49|31:48">
<para.text>
The creation of committees by the governing board of a not-for-profit corporation is authorized by <st>N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corp. Law &sect;712</st>. Such committees may be composed of not less than three directors. Such statute places certain specified restrictions on the authority that may be delegated to such committees as does <st>N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corp. Law &dblsect;509, 510</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
<trace.deleted/>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|49|31:48">
<para.text>
Loans to corporate officers and directors are prohibited. <st>N-PCL &sect;716</st>. A loan made in violation of this section will be a violation of the duty to the corporation of the directors or officers authorizing it or participating in it, but the obligation of the borrower with respect to the loan will not be affected thereby.
</para.text>
</para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text><rc>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;592 to 594</rc></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
<item.reference>
<name.block>
<label>ARTICLE</label>
<designator>TEN.</designator>
</name.block>
<item.reference>
<name.block>
<label>Section</label>
<designator>10.1.</designator>
</name.block>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|49|31:48">
<para.text>
A not-for-profit corporation is required to maintain correct and complete books and records of account. See <st>N-PCL &sect;621.</st>
</para.text>
</para>
<research.reference.block>

<item.reference>
<name.block>
<label>ARTICLE</label>
<designator>TEN.</designator>
</name.block>
<item.reference>
<name.block>
<label>Section</label>
<designator>10.3.</designator>
</name.block>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|49|31:48">
<para.text>
Adoption of a corporate seal is authorized by <st>N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corp. Law &sect;202(a)(3)</st>. The presence of the seal on a document is prima facie evidence of its execution by the corporation. <st>N-PCL &sect;107</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
</item.reference>
</item.reference>
<item.reference>
<name.block>
<label>ARTICLE</label>
<designator>TEN.</designator>
</name.block>
<item.reference>
<name.block>
<label>Section</label>
<designator>10.4.</designator>
</name.block>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|49|31:48">
<para.text>
This provision is authorized by <st>N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corp. Law &sect;108(a)</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
<research.reference.block>

<item.reference>
<name.block>
<label>ARTICLE</label>
<designator>ELEVEN.</designator>
</name.block>
<item.reference>
<name.block>
<label>Sections</label>
<designator>11.1, 11.2.</designator>
</name.block>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|49|31:48">
<para.text>
The rights of the members and board to amend the bylaws may be regulated by the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws. See <st>N-PCL §602.</st>
</para.text>
</para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text><rc>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;127</rc></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</item.reference>
</item.reference>
</item.reference.block>
</note.block>
</form>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block>
<label>&sect;</label>
<designator>31:49</designator>
<name>Bylaws<sep/> Nonprofit corporation<sep/> No members</name>
</outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>EBL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Ic708b8c0181b11e68c12afa7f3a24041">
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<head>
<name.block>
<label>ARTICLE</label>
<designator>I</designator>
<name>MEMBERS</name>
</name.block>
</head>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|50|31:49">
<form.text>The Corporation shall have no members.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<head>
<name.block>
<label>ARTICLE</label>
<designator>II</designator>
<name>DIRECTORS</name>
</name.block>
</head>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|50|31:49">
<form.text>Number and Election of Directors. The Board of Directors (“Board”) shall consist of not less than three members, the exact number of which shall initially be three, but such number shall be subject to change from time to time by the Board. Each director shall be at least eighteen years of age. Except as provided in paragraph 2(c) of this Article, directors shall be elected by a majority of the votes cast at an Annual Meeting of the Board, and each director so elected shall hold office until the next Annual Meeting and until his or her successor is duly elected and qualified, or until his or her earlier resignation, removal or death.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|50|31:49">
<form.text>Resignation; Removal; Vacancies.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(a)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|50|31:49">
<form.text>A director may resign at any time by giving written notice to the Board or to an officer of the Corporation. Unless otherwise specified in the notice, the resignation shall take effect upon receipt thereof by the Board or such officer. Acceptance of such resignation shall not be necessary to make it effective.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(b)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|50|31:49">
<form.text>Any or all of the directors may be removed by vote of the Board, with or without cause, provided there is a quorum of not less than a majority present at the meeting of the Board at which such action is taken.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(c)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|50|31:49">
<form.text>Vacancies and newly created directorships resulting from any increase in the authorized number of directors may be filled by a majority of the directors then in office, though less than a quorum, and the directors so chosen shall hold office until the next annual election and until their successors are duly elected and qualified, or until their earlier resignation, removal or death.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|50|31:49">
<form.text>Duties and Powers. The Board shall be the governing body of the Corporation. Accordingly, the business of the Corporation shall be managed by or under the direction of the Board and the Board shall have all such powers and authority to do all such lawful acts and things as are by statute or by the Certificate of Incorporation or by these Bylaws directed or required to be done in furtherance of the purposes of the Corporation.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|50|31:49">
<form.text>Meetings. The Board may hold its Annual Meetings and its regular and special meetings either within or without the State of New York. The time and place for holding Annual Meetings and regular meetings of the Board shall be fixed from time to time by the Board. Such meetings of the Board may be held without notice. A special meeting of the Board may be called by the President, any other officer, or by any one director, upon written demand of not less than one-fifth of the entire Board. Notice thereof stating the place, date and hour of the meeting shall be given to each director either by mail not less than <inline.instr>__lsqb__text number of hours__rsqb__</inline.instr> (<inline.instr>__lsqb__number of hours__rsqb__</inline.instr>) hours before the date of the meeting, by telephone, facsimile transmission or e-mail on <inline.instr>__lsqb__text number of hours__rsqb__</inline.instr> (<inline.instr>__lsqb__number of hours__rsqb__</inline.instr>) hours' notice, or on such shorter notice as the person or persons calling such meeting may deem necessary or appropriate in the circumstances. Notice of a meeting need not be given to any director who submits a signed or electronic waiver of notice whether before or after the meeting, or who attends the meeting without protesting, prior thereto or at its commencement, the lack of notice to such director.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|50|31:49">
<form.text>Quorum. Except as may be otherwise specifically provided by law, the Certificate of Incorporation or these Bylaws, at all meetings of the Board a majority of the entire Board shall constitute a quorum for the transaction bf business and the act of a majority of the directors present at any meeting at which there is a quorum shall be the act of the Board. If a quorum shall not be present at any meeting of the Board, the directors present thereat may adjourn the meeting from time to time, without notice other than announcement at the meeting, until a quorum shall be present.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|50|31:49">
<form.text>Action by the Board. Unless otherwise provided by the Certificate of Incorporation or these Bylaws, any action required or permitted to be taken at any meeting of the Board or of any committee thereof may be taken without a meeting if all the members of the Board or committee, as the case may be, consent to the adoption of a resolution authorizing the action. Such consent may be written or electronic. The resolution and written consents thereto by the members of the board or committee shall be filed with the minutes of the proceedings of the Board or committee.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|50|31:49">
<form.text>Meetings by Means of Conference Telephone. Unless otherwise provided by the Certificate of Incorporation or these Bylaws, any one or more members of the Board or of any committee thereof who is not physically present at a meeting of the board or a committee may participate by means of a conference telephone or similar communications equipment or by electronic video screen communication. Participation by such means shall constitute presence in person at a meeting as long as all persons participating in the meeting can hear each other at the same time and each director can participate in all matters before the Board, including, without limitation, the ability to propose, object to, and vote upon a specific action to be taken by the board or committee.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|50|31:49">
<form.text>Committees. The Board may, by resolution passed by a majority of the entire Board, designate from among its members an executive committee and other committees. Each committee so appointed shall consist of three or more directors and, to the extent provided in the resolution establishing it, shall have all the authority of the Board except as to the following matters:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(a)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|50|31:49">
<form.text>the filling of vacancies in the Board or in any committee;</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(b)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|50|31:49">
<form.text>the fixing of compensation of the directors for serving on the Board or any committee;</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(c)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|50|31:49">
<form.text>the amendment or repeal of the Bylaws or the adoption of new Bylaws; and</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(d)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|50|31:49">
<form.text>the amendment or repeal of any resolution of the Board which by its terms shall not be so amendable or repealable.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>The President shall appoint the Chair of each committee. The Board may designate one or more directors as alternate members of any committee, who may replace any absent member or members at any meeting of such committee.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<head>
<name.block>
<label>ARTICLE</label>
<designator>III</designator>
<name>OFFICERS</name>
</name.block>
</head>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|50|31:49">
<form.text>General. The officers of the Corporation shall be chosen by the Board and shall be a President, a Secretary and a Treasurer. In addition, the Board may, from time to time, appoint such other officers, including without limitation, one or more Vice-Presidents, and confer upon such officers those powers and duties which the Board shall deem necessary or advisable for the conduct of the affairs of the Corporation. Any two or more offices may be held by the same person, except the offices of President and Secretary. The President shall be a member of the Board. The other officers may, but need not, be members of the Board.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|50|31:49">
<form.text>Election. The Board at its Annual Meetings shall elect the officers of the Corporation who shall hold their offices for such terms and shall exercise such powers and perform such duties as are provided in these Bylaws or, to the extent not so provided, as shall be determined from time to time by the Board; and all officers of the Corporation shall hold office until their successors are elected or appointed and qualified, or until their earlier resignation, removal or death. Any officer elected by the Board may be removed at any time by the affirmative vote of a majority of the Board. Any vacancy occurring in any office of the Corporation shall be filled by the Board.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|50|31:49">
<form.text>President. The President shall preside at all meetings of the Board. The President shall have general supervision over the affairs of the Corporation, and shall keep the Board fully informed about the activities of the Corporation. He or she shall have the power to sign and execute alone in the name of the Corporation all contracts authorized either generally or specifically by the Board, unless the Board shall specifically require an additional signature. The President shall perform all the duties incident to the office of the President, and shall perform such other duties as from time to time may be assigned by the Board.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|50|31:49">
<form.text>Secretary. The secretary shall conduct the official correspondence, preserve all documents, books and communications, keep books of accounts, and maintain an accurate record of the proceedings of the corporation, the board of directors and all employees. At the expiration of his or her term of office he or she shall deliver to the board of directors the books, papers and other property of the corporation.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|50|31:49">
<form.text>Treasurer. The Treasurer shall keep or cause to be kept full and accurate accounts of receipts and disbursements of the Corporation, and shall deposit or cause to be deposited all moneys, evidences of indebtedness and other valuable documents of the Corporation in the name of or to the credit of the Corporation in such banks or depositories as the Board may designate. At the annual meeting and whenever else required by the Board, he or she shall render a statement of the Corporation's accounts. He or she shall at all reasonable times exhibit the Corporation's books and accounts to any Officer or Director of the Corporation, and shall perform all duties incident to the position of Treasurer, subject to the control of the Board, and shall when required, give such security for the faithful performance of his or her duties as the Board may determine.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<head>
<name.block>
<label>ARTICLE</label>
<designator>IV</designator>
<name>NOTICES</name>
</name.block>
</head>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|50|31:49">
<form.text>Notices. Whenever written notice is required by law, the Certificate of Incorporation or these Bylaws, to be given to any director or member of a committee, such notice may be given by mail, addressed to such director or member of a committee, at his or her address as it appears on the records of the Corporation, with postage thereon prepaid, and such notice shall be deemed to be given at the time when the same shall be deposited in the United States mail. Written notice may also be given personally or by facsimile transmission or electronic mail, and such notice is given when directed to the director or member's fax number or electronic mail address as it appears on the records of the Corporation, or, to such fax number or other electronic mail address as filed with the Secretary of the Corporation.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|50|31:49">
<form.text>Waivers of Notice. Whenever any notice is required by law, the Certificate of Incorporation or these Bylaws, to be given to any director or member of a committee, a waiver thereof in writing or electronic, signed or submitted by the person or persons entitled to said notice, whether before or after the time stated therein, shall be deemed equivalent thereto.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<head>
<name.block>
<label>ARTICLE</label>
<designator>V</designator>
<name>GENERAL PROVISIONS</name>
</name.block>
</head>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|50|31:49">
<form.text>Disbursements. All checks or demands for money and notes of the Corporation shall be signed by such officer or officers or such other person or persons as the Board may from time to time designate.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|50|31:49">
<form.text>Fiscal Year. The fiscal year of the Corporation shall be fixed by resolution of the Board.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<head>
<name.block>
<label>ARTICLE</label>
<designator>VI</designator>
<name>INDEMNIFICATION AND DIRECTORS' LIABILITY</name>
</name.block>
</head>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|50|31:49">
<form.text>Indemnification of Directors and Officers. To the fullest extent now or hereafter permitted by and in accordance with the standards and procedures provided for by <st>Sections 721 through 726 of the New York Not-for-Profit Corporation Law and any amendments thereto</st>, the Corporation shall indemnify any person made or threatened to be made a party to any action, suit or proceeding, whether civil, criminal, administrative or investigative, by reason of the fact that he or she is or was a director or officer of the Corporation and may indemnify any person made or threatened to be made a party to any action, suit or proceeding, whether civil, criminal, administrative or investigative, by reason of the fact that he or she is or was an employee or agent of the Corporation, against judgments, fines, amounts paid in settlement and reasonable expenses, including attorney's fees. Without limiting the generality of the foregoing, the Corporation may provide for indemnification and advancement of reasonable expenses, including attorneys' fees, actually and necessarily incurred by an indemnified person in connection with the defense of such action, or in connection with an appeal therein except in relation to matters as to which such director, officer, employee or agent is adjudged to have breached a duty to the Corporation under <st>Section 717 of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law</st>. Such indemnification may be authorized by resolution of the Board or by an agreement entered into with an individual director, officer employee or agent.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|50|31:49">
<form.text>Limitation on Liability of Directors. The personal liability of each of the directors of the Corporation shall be limited to the fullest extent permitted by <st>Section 720-a of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law as the same may be amended and supplemented.</st></form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<head>
<name.block>
<label>ARTICLE</label>
<designator>VII</designator>
<name>AMENDMENTS</name>
</name.block>
</head>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|50|31:49">
<form.text>These Bylaws may be altered, amended or repealed, in whole or in part, or new Bylaws may be adopted by the Board, provided, however, that notice of such alteration, amendment, repeal or adoption of new Bylaws be contained in the notice of such meeting of the Board. All such amendments must be approved by a majority of the entire Board then in office.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|50|31:49">
<form.text>Entire Board. As used in this ARTICLE VII and in these Bylaws generally, the term “entire Board” means the total number of directors which the Corporation would have if there were no vacancies.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
<note.block>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><tk>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3384</tk></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
</form>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block>
<label>&sect;</label>
<designator>31:50</designator>
<name>Bylaws<sep/> Charitable foundation for education scholarships</name>
</outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>EBL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Ic708dfd0181b11e68c12afa7f3a24041">
<form.unit>
<form.para>
<form.text>ARTICLE I.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|51|31:50">
<form.text>The corporation shall provide scholarships to accredited post-high school educational institutions for persons who are selected based on their leadership ability.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>ARTICLE II.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|51|31:50">
<form.text>No part of the net earnings of the corporation shall inure to the benefit of, or be distributable to, its members, directors, trustees, officers, or other private persons, except that the corporation shall be authorized and empowered to pay reasonable compensation for services rendered and to make payments and distributions in furtherance of the purpose set forth above. No substantial part of the activities of the corporation shall be the carrying on of propaganda or otherwise attempting to influence legislation, and the corporation shall not participate in or intervene in (including the publishing or distribution of statements) any political campaign on behalf of any candidate for public office. Notwithstanding any other provisions of these Articles, the corporation shall not carry on any other activities not permitted to be carried on: (a) by a corporation exempt from federal income tax under <st>Section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended (or the corresponding provision of any future United States Internal Revenue law)</st>; or (b) by a corporation, contributions to which are deductible under <st>Section 170(c)(2) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended (or the corresponding provision of any future United States Internal Revenue law)</st>.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>ARTICLE III.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|51|31:50">
<form.text>Upon the dissolution of the corporation, the Board of Directors shall, after paying or making provision for the payment of all of the liabilities of the corporation, dispose of all of the assets of the corporation for the purpose of advancement of education or shall distribute such assets to the federal government or to a state or local government for such purpose. Any such assets not so disposed of shall be disposed of by the circuit court of the county in which the principal office of the corporation is then located, exclusively for the advancement of education.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>ARTICLE IV</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|51|31:50">
<form.text>The corporation shall distribute its income for each taxable year at such time and in such manner as not to become subject to the tax on undistributed income imposed by <st>Section 4942 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended (or the corresponding provision of any future United States Internal Revenue law)</st>.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|51|31:50">
 <form.text>The corporation shall not engage in any act of self-dealing as defined in <st>Section 4941(d) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended (or the corresponding provision of any future United States Internal Revenue law)</st>.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|51|31:50">
<form.text>The corporation shall not retain any excess business holdings as defined in <st>Section 4943(c) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended (or the corresponding provision of any future United States Internal Revenue law)</st>.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|51|31:50">
<form.text>The corporation shall not make any investments in such manner as to subject it to tax under <st>Section 4944 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended (or the corresponding provision of any future United States Internal Revenue law)</st>.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|51|31:50">
 <form.text>The corporation shall not make any taxable expenditures as defined in <st>Section 4945(d) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended (or the corresponding provision of any future United States Internal Revenue law)</st>.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.unit>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|51|31:50">
<para.text>
Bylaws are the code or codes of rules adopted for the regulation or management of the affairs of the corporation irrespective of the name or names by which such rules are designated. <st>N-PCL §102(a)(2).</st>
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|51|31:50">
<para.text>
The bylaws may be adopted by the incorporators at the organization meeting or by the board of directors if the incorporators do not do so. <st>N-PCL &sect;602(a)</st>. In drafting any bylaws for a charitable corporation, it should be remembered that the bylaws may contain any provision relating to the business of the corporation, the conduct of its affairs, its rights or powers or the rights or powers of its members, directors, or officers, which are not inconsistent with statutory law or the certificate of incorporation. <st>N-PCL &sect;602(f)</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|51|31:50">
<para.text>
Note that <st>N-PCL &sect;602</st> has been amended by <st>L.2019, c. 558, &sect;2, eff. Jan. 24, 2020</st> that adds subsection (g) as follows:
</para.text>
</para>
<field>qp.pstart="n"</field>(g) In the case of residential not-for-profit corporations, changes including the adoption, amendment or repeal of the by-laws by the board of directors shall be provided to the members, stockholders, and delegates of such corporation in writing, by physical or electronic means, within ten days of such adoption.
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><tk>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3384</tk></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
</form>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block>
<label>&sect;</label>
<designator>31:51</designator>
<name>Bylaws<sep/> Provision<sep/> Automatic succession of vice president to presidency</name>
</outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>CLS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Ic70906e0181b11e68c12afa7f3a24041">
<form.unit>
<form.para>
<form.text>1.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|52|31:51">
<form.text>In addition to his or her other rights and duties, the Vice President shall serve as President Elect and shall succeed to the office of President upon the expiration of the President's term of office.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>2.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|52|31:51">
<form.text>The term of office of the Vice President is <inline.instr>__lsqb__identification of year__rsqb__</inline.instr> years, beginning on <inline.instr>__lsqb__begin date of term__rsqb__</inline.instr> and expiring on <inline.instr>__lsqb__end date of term__rsqb__</inline.instr>. At the expiration of this term, the Vice President shall succeed to the office of President and shall serve as President beginning on <inline.instr>__lsqb__begin date of term__rsqb__</inline.instr> and expiring on <inline.instr>__lsqb__end date of term__rsqb__</inline.instr>.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>3.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|52|31:51">
<form.text>In the event of the resignation, removal, incapacity, lapse in membership, or death of the President while in office, the Vice President shall succeed to the office of President and serve as President both the remainder of the prior President's term and the full succeeding term of office as President.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>4.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|52|31:51">
<form.text>In the event of the resignation, removal, incapacity, lapse in membership, or death of the Vice President, one or more successors shall be nominated by the Board of Directors and a special election for office of Vice President shall be conducted <inline.instr>__lsqb__within a stated number of days/within a reasonable time/as soon as practicable__rsqb__</inline.instr>. However, if the vacancy in the office of Vice President occurs less than <inline.instr>__lsqb__number of days__rsqb__</inline.instr> days before the scheduled expiration of the Vice President's term, a successor shall not be nominated or elected until the next scheduled election for officers.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>5.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|52|31:51">
<form.text>A Vice President who resigns, is removed, becomes incapacitated, or fails to remain a member in good standing shall not succeed to the office of President.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.unit>
<note.block>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><tk>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3384</tk></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><tk>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3420 to 3433</tk></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text><rc>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;531</rc></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
</form>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block>
<label>&sect;</label>
<designator>31:52</designator>
<name>Bylaws<sep/> Provision<sep/> Prohibition against sharing in charitable foundation earnings</name>
</outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>CLS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Ic7092df0181b11e68c12afa7f3a24041">
<form.para>
<form.text>No member, director, trustee, officer, or employee of, or member of a committee of, or person connected with, the charitable foundation or any other private individual shall receive at any time any of the net earnings or pecuniary profit from the operations of the charitable foundation, provided that this shall not prevent the payment to any such person of such reasonable compensation for services rendered to or for the charitable foundation in effecting any of its purposes as shall be fixed by the board of directors; in addition, no such person or persons shall be entitled to share in the distribution of any of the charitable foundation assets upon the dissolution of the charitable foundation.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|53|31:52">
<form.text>
All members of the corporation shall be deemed to have expressly consented and agreed that, upon such dissolution or winding up of the affairs of the charitable foundation, whether voluntary or involuntary, the assets of the charitable foundation, after all debts have been satisfied, then remaining in the hands of the board of directors shall be distributed, transferred, conveyed, delivered, and paid over for the purpose of advancement of education, or shall distribute such assets to the federal government or to a state or local government for such purpose. Any such assets not so disposed of shall be disposed of by the Supreme Court of the county in which the principal office of the charitable foundation is then located, exclusively for the advancement of education. The charitable foundation shall have the right to retain all or any part of any securities or property acquired by it in whatever manner and to invest and reinvest any funds held by it according to the judgment of the board of directors, without being restricted to the class of investments which a director is or may hereafter be permitted by law to make or any similar restriction, provided, however, that no action shall be taken by or on behalf of the charitable foundation if such action is a prohibited transaction or would result in the denial of the tax exemption under <st>Section 503</st> or <st>Section 507 of the Internal Revenue Code</st> and its regulations as they now exist or as they may hereafter be amended.
</form.text>
</form.para>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|53|31:52">
<para.text>
Bylaws are the code or codes of rules adopted for the regulation or management of the affairs of the corporation irrespective of the name or names by which such rules are designated. <st>N-PCL §102(a)(2).</st>
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|53|31:52">
<para.text>
The bylaws may be adopted by the incorporators at the organization meeting or by the board of directors if the incorporators do not do so. <st>N-PCL &sect;602(a).</st> In drafting any bylaws for a charitable corporation, it should be remembered that the bylaws may contain any provision relating to the business of the corporation, the conduct of its affairs, its rights or powers or the rights or powers of its members, directors, or officers, which are not inconsistent with statutory law or the certificate of incorporation. <st>N-PCL &sect;602(f).</st>
</para.text>
</para>
<trace.deleted/>
<trace.deleted/>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><tk>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3384</tk></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
</form>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block>
<label>&sect;</label>
<designator>31:53</designator>
<name>Bylaws<sep/> Provision<sep/> Contracts, checks, deposits, and funds</name>
</outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>CLS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Ic7095500181b11e68c12afa7f3a24041">
<form.para>
<form.text>Contracts. The board of directors may authorize any officer or officers, agent or agents of the charitable foundation, in addition to the officers so authorized by these bylaws to enter into any contract or execute and deliver any instrument in the name of and on behalf of the charitable foundation, and such authority may be general or confined to specific instances.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|54|31:53">
<form.text>
Checks, Drafts, Etc. All checks, drafts, or other orders for the payment of money, notes, or other evidences of indebtedness issued in the name of the charitable foundation shall be signed by such officer or officers, agent, or agents of the charitable foundation and in such manner as shall, from time to time, be determined by resolution of the Board of Directors. In the absence of such determination by the board of directors, such instruments shall be signed by the Treasurer or an assistant Treasurer and countersigned by the President or a Vice President of the charitable foundation.
</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|54|31:53">
<form.text>
Deposits. All funds of the charitable foundation shall be deposited, from time to time, to the credit of the corporation in such banks, trust companies, or other depositaries as the Board of Directors may select.
</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|54|31:53">
<form.text>
Gifts. The Board of Directors may accept on behalf of the charitable foundation any contribution, gift, bequest, or devise for the general purposes or for any special purpose of the charitable foundation.
</form.text>
</form.para>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|54|31:53">
<para.text>
Bylaws are the code or codes of rules adopted for the regulation or management of the affairs of the corporation irrespective of the name or names by which such rules are designated. <st>N-PCL §102(a)(2)</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|54|31:53">
<para.text>
The bylaws may be adopted by the incorporators at the organization meeting or by the Board of Directors if the incorporators do not do so. <st>N-PCL &sect;602(a).</st> In drafting any bylaws for a charitable corporation, it should be remembered that the bylaws may contain any provision relating to the business of the corporation, the conduct of its affairs, its rights or powers or the rights or powers of its members, directors, or officers, which are not inconsistent with statutory law or the certificate of incorporation. <st>N-PCL &sect;602(f).</st>
</para.text>
</para>
<trace.deleted/>
<trace.deleted/>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><tk>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3384</tk></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text><rc>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;116 to 129</rc></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>

</section.body>
