<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block>
<label>&sect;</label>
<designator>31:79</designator>
<name>Charitable foundation trust agreement</name>
</outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>EPP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TAO</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>EBL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Ic70e0ff0181b11e68c12afa7f3a24041">
<form.para>
<form.text>Agreement dated as of the day of <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of month__rsqb__</inline.instr> <inline.instr>__lsqb__identification of year__rsqb__</inline.instr>, between <inline.instr>__lsqb__names of donors__rsqb__</inline.instr> as Donors (hereinafter called the Donors), and <inline.instr>__lsqb__names of trustees__rsqb__</inline.instr>, as Trustees (hereinafter called the Trustees).</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.para>
<form.text>WITNESSETH:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|81|31:79">
<form.text>That the Donors hereby assign, transfer, and set over unto the Trustees and their successors and assigns all the Donor's right, title, and interest in and to the property described in Schedule <inline.instr>__lsqb__designation of schedule__rsqb__</inline.instr> hereto annexed and made a part of this Agreement, receipt of which the Trustees hereby acknowledge, this Trust to be known as the <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of trust__rsqb__</inline.instr>.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|81|31:79">
<form.text>Said property, together with any additions, is termed the “trust estate” and shall be held in trust upon the following terms.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|81|31:79">
 <form.text>First: The Trustees may receive and accept property, whether real, personal, or mixed, by way of gift, bequest, or devise, from any person, firm, trust, or corporation, to be held, administered, and disposed of in accordance with and pursuant to the provisions of this Trust, but no gift, bequest, or devise of any such property shall be received and accepted if it is conditioned or limited in such manner as to require the disposition of the income or its principal to any person or organization other than a charitable organization or for other than charitable purposes within the meaning of such terms, as defined in <x>ARTICLE SECOND of this Trust</x>, or as shall, in the opinion of the Trustees, jeopardize the federal income tax exemption of this trust pursuant to <st>Section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code or the corresponding section of any future federal tax code.</st></form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|81|31:79">
<form.text>Second:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(A)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|81|31:79">
<form.text>The principal and income of all property received and accepted by the Trustees to be administered under this Trust shall be held in trust by them, and the Trustees may make payments or distributions from income or principal, or both, to or for the use of such charitable organizations, within the meaning of that term as defined in Paragraph D hereof, in such amounts and for such charitable purposes of the Trust as the Trustees shall, from time to time, select and determine; in addition, the Trustees may make payments or distributions from income or principal, or both, directly for such charitable purposes, within the meaning of that term as defined in Paragraph E hereof, in such amounts as the Trustees shall, from time to time, select and determine without making use of any other charitable organization. The Trustees may also make payments or distributions of all or any part of the income or principal to states, territories, or possessions of the United States, any political subdivision of any of the foregoing, or to the United States or the District of Columbia but only for charitable purposes within the meaning of that term as defined in Paragraph E hereof. Income or principal derived from contributions by corporations shall be distributed by the Trustees for use solely within the United States or its possessions. No part of the net earnings of this Trust shall inure or be payable to or for the benefit of any private shareholder or individual, except that the Trustees may make distributions to individuals in furtherance of the charitable purposes set forth in this Paragraph, and no substantial part of the activities of this Trust shall be the carrying on of propaganda or otherwise attempting to influence legislation. No part of the activities of this Trust shall be the participation in or intervention in (including the publishing or distributing of statements) any political campaign on behalf of any candidate for public office.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(B)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|81|31:79">
 <form.text>The Trust shall continue forever unless the Trustees terminate it and distribute all of the principal and income, which action may be taken by the Trustees in their discretion at any time. On such termination, assets shall be distributed for one or more exempt purposes within the meaning of <st>Section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code</st> or the corresponding section of any future federal tax code or shall be distributed to the federal government, or to a state or local government, for a public purpose.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(C)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|81|31:79">
<form.text>The Donors authorize and empower the Trustees to form and organize a nonprofit corporation limited to the uses and purposes provided for in this Trust, such corporation to be organized under the laws of any state or under the laws of the United States as may be determined by the Trustees and such corporation, when organized, to have power to administer and control the affairs and property and to carry out the uses, objects, and purposes of this Trust. Upon the creation and organization of such corporation, the Trustees are authorized and empowered to convey, transfer, and deliver to such corporation all the property and assets to which this Trust may be or become entitled. The charter, bylaws, and other provisions for the organization and management of such corporation and its affairs and property shall be such as the Trustees shall determine, consistent with the provisions of this Paragraph C.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(D)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|81|31:79">
<form.text>In this Trust and in any amendments to it, references to “charitable organizations” or “charitable organization” mean corporations, trusts, funds, foundations, or community chests organized and operated exclusively for charitable purposes, no part of the net earnings of which inures or is payable to or for the benefit of any private shareholder or individual and no substantial part of the activities of which is carrying on propaganda or otherwise attempting to influence legislation, and which do not participate in, or intervene in, (including the publishing or distributing of statements) any political campaign on behalf of or in opposition to any candidate for public office. It is intended that the organizations described in this Paragraph D shall be entitled to exemption from federal income tax under <st>Section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code</st> or the corresponding section of any future federal tax code.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(E)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|81|31:79">
<form.text>In this Trust and in any amendments to it, the term “charitable purposes” shall be limited to and shall include only religious, charitable, scientific, literary, or educational purposes, within the meaning of those terms as used in <st>Section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code or the corresponding section of any future federal tax code</st>, but only such purposes as also constitute public charitable purposes under the law of trusts of the State of New York.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|81|31:79">
<form.text>Third: This Trust may be amended at any time or times by written instrument or instruments signed and sealed by the Trustees and acknowledged by a majority of the Trustees, provided that no amendment shall authorize the Trustees to conduct the affairs of this Trust in any manner or for any purpose contrary to the provisions of <st>Section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code</st> or the corresponding section of any future federal tax code. An amendment of the provisions of this ARTICLE THIRD (or any amendment to it) shall be valid only if and to the extent that such amendment further restricts the Trustees' amending power. All instruments amending this Trust shall be noted upon or kept attached to the executed original of this Trust held by the Trustees.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|81|31:79">
<form.text>Fourth:</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(A)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|81|31:79">
<form.text>If <inline.instr>__lsqb__names of trustees__rsqb__</inline.instr> shall fail or cease to act as Trustees hereunder, then <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of trustee 1__rsqb__</inline.instr> shall become a Trustee hereunder. If <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of trustee 1__rsqb__</inline.instr> shall fail or cease to act as a Trustee hereunder, then <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of trustee 2__rsqb__</inline.instr> shall become a Trustee hereunder. Subject to the foregoing order of designation, any Trustee in office hereunder shall have the power to appoint an individual successor Trustee or a succession of individuals to succeed him or her and to serve as a Trustee hereunder if he or she shall fail or cease to act as a Trustee hereunder.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(B)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|81|31:79">
<form.text>Any Trustee under this Trust may, by written instrument, signed and acknowledged, resign his or her office, provided, however, that a sole Trustee shall not be permitted to resign unless and until a successor is appointed.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(C)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|81|31:79">
<form.text>A Trustee may appoint one or more additional Trustees. Appointments shall be made by the Trustee or Trustees for the time in office by written instruments signed and acknowledged. Any succeeding or additional Trustee shall, upon his or her acceptance of the office by written instrument signed and acknowledged, have the same powers, rights, and duties and the same title to the Trust estate jointly with the surviving or remaining Trustee or Trustees as if originally appointed.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(D)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|81|31:79">
<form.text>Except as otherwise provided herein, if there shall be three or more Trustees, the decisions and acts of a majority of the Trustees shall be required to exercise the powers and discretions conferred upon the Trustees. Except as otherwise provided herein, if there shall be one or two Trustees at any time, a unanimous vote of the Trustees shall be and constitute an exercise of the Trust powers and discretions conferred upon the Trustees.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(E)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|81|31:79">
<form.text>No Trustee shall be required to furnish any bond or surety. No Trustee shall be responsible or liable for the acts or omissions of any other Trustee or of any predecessor or of a custodian, agent, depositary, or counsel selected with reasonable care.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(F)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|81|31:79">
<form.text>A Trustee may, by appropriate written instrument, delegate all or any part of his or her powers to another or others of the Trustees for such periods and subject to such conditions as such delegating Trustee may determine.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(G)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|81|31:79">
<form.text>The Trustees serving under this Trust are authorized to pay to themselves amounts for reasonable expenses incurred and reasonable compensation for services rendered in the administration of this Trust, but in no event shall any Trustee who has made a contribution to this Trust receive any compensation thereafter.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|81|31:79">
<form.text>Fifth: In extension and not in limitation of the common-law and statutory powers of Trustees and other powers granted in this Trust, the Trustees shall have the following discretionary powers:</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(A)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|81|31:79">
<form.text>To invest and reinvest the principal and income of the Trust in such property, real, personal, or mixed, and in such manner as they shall deem proper and, from time to time, to change investments as they shall deem advisable; to invest in or retain any stocks, shares, bonds, notes, obligations, or personal or real property (including without limitation any interests in or obligations of any corporation, association, business trust, investment trust, common Trust Fund, or investment company), although some or all of the property so acquired or retained is a kind or size which, but for this express authority, would not be considered proper and although all of the trust funds are invested in the securities of one company. No principal or income, however, shall be loaned, directly or indirectly, to any Trustee or to anyone else, corporate or otherwise, who has at any time made a contribution to this Trust nor to anyone except on the basis of an adequate interest charge and with adequate security.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(B)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|81|31:79">
<form.text>To sell, lease, or exchange any personal, mixed, or real property at public auction or by private contract for such consideration and on such terms as to credit or otherwise and to make such contracts and enter into such undertakings relating to the Trust property, as they consider advisable, whether or not such leases or contracts may extend beyond the duration of the Trust.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(C)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|81|31:79">
<form.text>To borrow money for such periods, at such rates of interest, and upon such terms as the Trustees consider advisable and, as security for such loans, to mortgage or pledge any real or personal property with or without power of sale; to acquire or hold any real or personal property, subject to any mortgage or pledge; and to assume any mortgage or pledge on or of property acquired or held by this Trust.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(D)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|81|31:79">
<form.text>To execute and deliver deeds, assignments, transfers, mortgages, pledges, leases, covenants, contracts, promissory notes, releases, and other instruments, sealed or unsealed, incident to any transaction in which they engage.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(E)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|81|31:79">
<form.text>To vote, to give proxies, to participate in the reorganization, merger, or consolidation of any concern or in the <inline.instr>__lsqb__description of article__rsqb__</inline.instr> sale, lease, disposition, or distribution of its assets; to join with other security holders in acting through a committee, depositary, voting trustees, or otherwise and, in this connection, to delegate authority to such committee, depositary, or trustees and to deposit securities with them or transfer securities to them; and to pay assessments levied on securities or to exercise subscription rights in respect of securities.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(F)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|81|31:79">
<form.text>To employ a bank or trust company as custodian of any funds or securities and to delegate to it such powers as they deem appropriate; to hold Trust property without indication of fiduciary capacity but only in the name of a registered nominee, provided the Trust property is at all times identified as such on the books of the Trust; to keep any or all of the Trust property or funds in any place or places in the United States of America; to employ clerks, accountants, investment counsel, investment agents, and any special services and to pay the reasonable compensation and expense of all such services in addition to the compensation of the Trustees.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|81|31:79">
<form.text>Sixth: The Trustees' powers are exercisable solely in a fiduciary capacity consistent with and in furtherance of the charitable purposes of this Trust as specified in ARTICLE SECOND and not otherwise.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|81|31:79">
<form.text>Seventh:</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(A)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|81|31:79">
 <form.text>Any other provisions of this instrument notwithstanding, the Trustees shall distribute its income for each tax year at such time and in such manner so that it will not become subject to the tax on undistributed income imposed by <st>Section 4942 of the Internal Revenue Code</st> or corresponding provisions of any future federal tax laws.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(B)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|81|31:79">
<form.text>Any other provisions of this instrument notwithstanding, the Trustees will not engage in any act of self-dealing as defined in <st>Section 4941(d) of the Internal Revenue Code</st> or corresponding provisions of any future federal tax laws; nor retain any excess business holdings as defined in <st>Section 4943(c) of the Internal Revenue Code</st> or corresponding provisions of any future federal tax laws; nor make any investments in a manner that would incur tax liability under <st>Section 4944 of the Internal Revenue Code</st> or corresponding provisions of any future federal tax laws; nor make any taxable expenditures as defined in <st>Section 4945(d) of the Internal Revenue Code</st>, or corresponding provisions of any future federal tax laws.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|81|31:79">
<form.text>Eighth: In this Trust and in any amendment to it, references to “Trustees” mean the one or more Trustees, whether original or successor, for the time being in office.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|81|31:79">
<form.text>Ninth: Any person may rely on a copy, certified by a notary public, of the executed original of this Trust held by the Trustees and of any of the notations on it and writings attached to it, as fully as he or she might rely on the original documents themselves. Any such person may rely fully on any statements of fact certified by anyone who appears from such original documents or from such certified copy to be a Trustee under this Trust. No one dealing with the Trustees need inquire concerning the validity of anything the Trustees purport to do.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|81|31:79">
<form.text>Tenth: Except as the context shall otherwise plainly require, words in the masculine or feminine gender shall be deemed to include masculine, feminine, and neuter genders and words in the singular or plural number shall be deemed to include both singular and plural numbers.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|81|31:79">
<form.text>Eleventh: This Trust is to be governed in all respects by the laws of the State of New York.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|81|31:79">
<form.text>In Witnesseth Whereof, the parties hereto have set their respective hands and seals as of the day and year first written.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|81|31:79">
 <form.text>Any other provisions of this instrument notwithstanding, the Trustees will not engage in any act of self-dealing as defined in <st>Section 4941(d) of the Internal Revenue Code</st> or corresponding provisions of any future federal tax laws; nor retain any excess business holdings as defined in <st>Section 4943(c) of the Internal Revenue Code</st> or corresponding provisions of any future federal tax laws; nor make any investments in a manner that would incur tax liability under <st>Section 4944 of the Internal Revenue Code</st> or corresponding provisions of any future federal tax laws; nor make any taxable expenditures as defined in <st>Section 4945(d) of the Internal Revenue Code</st>, or corresponding provisions of any future federal tax laws.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|81|31:79">
<form.text>Eighth: In this Trust and in any amendment to it, references to “Trustees” mean the one or more Trustees, whether original or successor, for the time being in office.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|81|31:79">
<form.text>Ninth: Any person may rely on a copy, certified by a notary public, of the executed original of this Trust held by the Trustees and of any of the notations on it and writings attached to it, as fully as he or she might rely on the original documents themselves. Any such person may rely fully on any statements of fact certified by anyone who appears from such original documents or from such certified copy to be a Trustee under this Trust. No one dealing with the Trustees need inquire concerning the validity of anything the Trustees purport to do.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|81|31:79">
<form.text>Tenth: Except as the context shall otherwise plainly require, words in the masculine or feminine gender shall be deemed to include masculine, feminine, and neuter genders and words in the singular or plural number shall be deemed to include both singular and plural numbers.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|81|31:79">
<form.text>Eleventh: This Trust is to be governed in all respects by the laws of the State of New York.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|81|31:79">
<form.text>In Witnesseth Whereof, the parties hereto have set their respective hands and seals as of the day and year first written.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>

<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<trace.deleted/>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|81|31:79">
<para.text>
This agreement will create a private foundation under <st>Section 509 of the Internal Revenue Code</st> with attendant excise taxes and reporting requirements resulting in additional administration expenses and restrictions. It is based in part on the suggested form found in <st>IRS Pub. 557</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
<form.name.block>Seventh.</form.name.block>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|81|31:79">
<para.text>
If a disqualified person engages in self-dealing with a trust, that person is subject to a 10% tax that goes up to 200% if the self-dealing is not rectified. <st>26 U.S.C.A. &sect;4941</st>. A disqualified person is one or more of the following: (See <st>26 U.S.C.A. &sect;4946(a)</st>.)
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|81|31:79">
<para.text>
1) a substantial contributor;
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|81|31:79">
<para.text>
2) a foundation manager;
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|81|31:79">
<para.text>
3) a person who owns more than 20% of a corporation, partnership, trust, or unincorporated enterprise which is itself a substantial contributor; and/or
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|81|31:79">
<para.text>
4) a member of the family of any individual of the first three categories.
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|81|31:79">
<para.text>
Self-dealing includes certain financial transactions, engaged in directly or indirectly by a “disqualified person.” See <st>26 C.F.R. &sect;53.4941(d)-2</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><tk>West's Key Number Digest, Charities &key;1 et seq</tk>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
</form>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block>
<label>&sect;</label>
<designator>31:80</designator>
<name>Charitable foundation trust agreement<sep/> Corporate settlor</name>
</outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>EPP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TAO</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>EBL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Ic70e5e10181b11e68c12afa7f3a24041">
<form.para>
<form.text>This Agreement, made this <inline.instr>__lsqb__date of agreement__rsqb__</inline.instr>, between <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of settlor__rsqb__</inline.instr>, a corporation organized under the laws of the State of New York (hereinafter called “Settlor”) party of the first part, and <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of corporate trustee__rsqb__</inline.instr>, a corporation organized under the laws of the State of New York (hereinafter called “Corporate Trustee”), and <inline.instr>__lsqb__names of trustees__rsqb__</inline.instr> (hereinafter called “Individual Trustees”) parties of the second part (hereinafter collectively called “Trustees”).</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.para>
<form.text>WITNESSETH:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|82|31:80">
<form.text>Whereas the Settlor has supported and is desirous of continuing to discharge its duty to support worthy philanthropic causes in the communities in which it operates and which it serves and of contributing generally to the public welfare through the alleviation of human suffering; the advancement of science, education, and the cultural arts; and the promotion of our traditional way of life and is further desirous of establishing a systematic plan for the accomplishment of such purposes;</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|82|31:80">
<form.text>Now, Therefore, the Settlor gives to the Trustees the sum of $<inline.instr>__lsqb__dollar amount of payment__rsqb__</inline.instr>, the receipt whereof is hereby acknowledged by the Trustees;</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|82|31:80">
<form.text>To Have and to Hold the same and such monies and properties as may be added thereto by the Settlor or by any other corporations or persons (provided such additions are accepted by the Trustees) in trust for the uses and subject to the terms and conditions hereinafter set forth, as follows:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>I</designator>
<name>NAME</name>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|82|31:80">
<form.text>The Trust hereby created shall be known as the <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of foundation__rsqb__</inline.instr>.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|82|31:80">
```xml
<form.text>The earnings of the Trust Fund and so much of the principal as the Trustees, from time to time, shall deem appropriate shall be used (except to the extent necessary to defray administration expenses) exclusively for contributions to organizations, including governmental bodies, operated exclusively for religious, charitable, educational, veteran rehabilitation service, literary, or scientific purposes or for prevention of cruelty to children or animals, no substantial part of the activities of which is carrying on propaganda or otherwise attempting to influence legislation or the election of public officials, provided, however, that such contributions may be made only for use within the United States or its possessions and provided, also, that the organizations to which the contributions are made: (a) are exempt from taxation under the <st>Internal Revenue Code of 1986</st>; and (b) shall not be classified as a private foundation or private foundation charitable trust under the <st>Internal Revenue Code of 1986</st>, except that the restriction contained in this clause (b) shall not apply to operating private foundations as defined in <st>Section 4942(j)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986</st>. The Trust shall not engage in any activities that are unlawful under the laws of the United States of America, the State of New York, or any other state, district, territory, or possession of the United States where its activities or the activities of the Settlor are carried on, nor shall the Trust engage in any transaction described as “prohibited” by requirements of the <st>Internal Revenue Code</st> relating to the exemption of organizations from income and profits taxes or that would attract an excise tax or otherwise result in loss of tax exempt status under the <st>Internal Revenue Code of 1986</st>. In furtherance and not limitation of the restrictions and limitations herein set forth, the Trust shall never be operated for the purpose of carrying on a trade or business for profit, and no payment of principal or income shall ever be made to the Settlor (as such term is defined in <x>ARTICLE IV(1) of this Agreement</x>) or to any private shareholder of the Settlor, unless the shareholder be an organization entitled to receive contributions hereunder, or to any officer, director, or employee of the Settlor or to any Trustee of this Trust, except as a reasonable allowance for actual expenditures or services actually rendered as such Trustee, it being the intent that no part of the Trust Fund or the earnings thereof shall ever inure to the benefit of any private individuals within the meaning of the tax-exemption requirements of the laws of the United States, the State of New York, or any other state, district, territory, or possession of the United States that might have or claim jurisdiction over the Settlor or the Trust.</form.text>
```
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|82|31:80">
<form.text>All references in this Agreement to provisions or requirements in the <st>Internal Revenue Code of 1986</st> shall also include corresponding provisions in such Code as amended from time to time and in subsequent tax laws of the United States. The term “excise tax” as used in this Agreement shall not include the tax imposed by <st>Section 4940 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986</st>.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|82|31:80">
<form.text>It shall be the function of the Individual Trustees to determine to whom and in what amounts and at what times and under what conditions contributions shall be made in furtherance of the purposes of the Trust. Accordingly, the Corporate Trustee shall make such disbursements of principal and income as may be directed from time to time by a majority of the Individual Trustees in writing, signed by them, and delivered to the Corporate Trustee, certifying that the disbursement is proper under ARTICLE II of this Agreement, and, upon making such disbursement, the Corporate Trustee shall be discharged from any liability concerning such disbursement.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|82|31:80">
<form.text>It shall be the function of the Corporate Trustee to receive and to hold in safekeeping all assets of the Trust or appropriate evidences of ownership thereof, to make all authorized disbursements from the Trust, to keep records of all receipts and disbursements by and from the Trust, and generally to administer the Trust fund. Accordingly, the Corporate Trustee is vested hereby with all appropriate powers (to be exercised upon the determination of a majority of the then acting Trustees, including among them the Corporate Trustee) granted by law to Trustees, including (but not by way of limitation) the following:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>1</designator>
<name>Investments.</name>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|82|31:80">
<form.text>To invest and reinvest the fund and keep the fund invested in such stocks, bonds, or other investments as the Corporate Trustee may deem suitable for the fund, whether or not the same are authorized, under the laws of the State of New York, for the investment of trust funds (but no part of the Trust Fund shall be invested in the shares or obligations of or loans to the Settlor). The Corporate Trustee in its discretion may keep such portion of the fund in cash balances as it may, from time to time, deem needful or appropriate, and it shall be without obligation to pay interest on any such cash balances. No investments shall be made hereunder that would attract an excise tax on account of such investments under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. For the purposes of this paragraph 1 the term “Settlor” shall include any business organization, foreign or domestic: (a) with which the Settlor could file a consolidated return under the Internal Revenue Code of the United States if such entity were a domestic corporation; or (b) the stockholdings of which are attributed to Settlor under any provision of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>2</designator>
<name>Sale.</name>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|82|31:80">
<form.text>To sell, exchange, convey, transfer, or otherwise dispose of any property held by it.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>3</designator>
<name>Owner.</name>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|82|31:80">
<form.text>To vote upon any stocks, bonds, or other securities; to give general or special proxies or powers of attorney with or without power of substitution; to exercise any conversion privileges, subscription rights, or other options and to make any payments incidental thereto; to consent to or otherwise participate in corporate reorganization or other changes affecting corporate securities; to delegate discretionary powers; to pay any assessments or charges in connection therewith; and generally to exercise any of the powers of an owner with respect to stocks, bonds, securities, or other property held in the Fund.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>4</designator>
<name>Execution of Instruments.</name>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|82|31:80">
<form.text>To make, execute, acknowledge, and deliver any and all documents of transfer and conveyance and any and all other instruments that may be necessary or appropriate to carry out the powers herein granted.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>5</designator>
<name>Registration.</name>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|82|31:80">
<form.text>To register any investment held in the fund in its own name or in the name of a nominee and to hold any investment in bearer form, but the records of the Trustee shall at all times show that all such investments are part of the fund.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>6</designator>
<name>Legal Counsel.</name>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|82|31:80">
<form.text>To employ suitable agents and counsel and pay their reasonable expenses and compensation; to prosecute, defend, settle, or compromise or submit to arbitration any claims, debts, or damages due to or from the Trust.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>7</designator>
<name>Borrow Money.</name>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|82|31:80">
<form.text>To borrow money (from itself or others, except the Settlor) in such amounts and upon such terms as it shall deem advisable to carry out the purposes of the Trust and to pledge any property for the repayment of any such loan.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>V</designator>
<name>ACCOUNTS</name>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|82|31:80">
<form.text>The Trustees shall annually render to the Settlor an account of their transactions and the Settlor may approve each such account by instrument in writing signed by the President, a Vice President, the Treasurer, or Secretary of the Settlor and delivered to the Corporate Trustee. If no objection to any such account shall be filed in writing with the Corporate Trustee within <inline.instr>__lsqb__number of days__rsqb__</inline.instr> days after delivery of the account to the Settlor, the Settlor shall be deemed to have approved the account. Upon approval by the Settlor, whether explicitly or by implication, as above, the Trustees shall be released and discharged with respect to all matters reported in the account as though the account had been settled in a court of competent jurisdiction. The Trustees nevertheless may at any time seek a judicial settlement of their accounts in the courts of the State of New York or may in the courts of the same state seek determination of a question of construction or otherwise ask for instruction, and, except as otherwise required by the laws of the State of New York, the only necessary parties to any such proceeding shall be the Settlor and the Trustees; the Trustees or the Corporate Trustee, however, at their or its election may name as parties in any such proceeding any other person, persons, or governmental authority.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>1</designator>
<name>Resignation of Trustee; Removal; Successor Trustee; Additional Trustees.</name>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|82|31:80">
<form.text>Any Trustee acting hereunder may resign at any time by giving written notice to the Settlor. The Settlor may remove any Trustee at any time. Upon the death, removal, or resignation of any Trustee, the Settlor shall appoint a successor Trustee by instrument in writing delivered to the then Corporate Trustee or successor Corporate Trustee, as the case may be, but, if at any time a vacancy shall exist among the Individual Trustees, the remaining Individual Trustees during such time shall have all of the powers herein granted to Individual Trustees. There shall always be a Corporate Trustee that shall be an organization authorized to act as such under the laws of the State of New York. Upon appointment of a successor Corporate Trustee, the predecessor Corporate Trustee shall deliver the Trust Fund to its successor after reserving such funds as it may deem necessary to pay all then existing proper charges against the Trust. Successor Trustees shall have the same powers as those conferred upon their class (that is, Corporate or Individual) by the terms of this Agreement. The Settlor may appoint an additional Trustee or additional Trustees at any time by instrument in writing delivered to the then Corporate Trustee or Successor Corporate Trustee, provided that notwithstanding anything contained in this ARTICLE VI(1), vacancy in the office of individual Trustee need not be filled.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>2</designator>
<name>Liability.</name>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|82|31:80">
<form.text>No Trustee shall be liable hereunder for the acts or omissions of any other Trustee or for any cause, save for its, his, or her own negligence or breach of trust. All persons dealing with the Trustees are released from inquiry into the authority of the Trustees and from seeing to the application of any money or other property paid or delivered to the Corporate Trustee.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>3</designator>
<name>Compensation.</name>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|82|31:80">
<form.text>The Corporate Trustee shall be paid such reasonable compensation as shall, from time to time, be agreed upon between the Settlor and the Corporate Trustee. The Individual Trustees shall serve without compensation. Both the Corporate and the Individual Trustees shall be entitled to reimbursement for their reasonable expenses incurred in the performance of their duties as Trustees. The compensation of the Corporate Trustee and all expenses of administration shall be a charge against the Trust Fund, unless paid by the Settlor.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>4</designator>
<name>Exculpatory Clause.</name>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|82|31:80">
<form.text>Any action by the Settlor pursuant to any of the provisions of this Agreement shall be evidenced by a resolution of its Board of Directors certified to the Trustees over the signature of its Secretary or Assistant Secretary under the Corporate seal. The Trustees severally shall be fully protected in acting upon any instrument in writing believed by them to be genuine and to be signed by the proper person or persons; they shall be under no duty to make any inquiry as to any statement contained in any such writing but may accept the same as conclusive evidence of the truth, completeness, and accuracy of the statements therein contained.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>5</designator>
<name>Additional Trustees.</name>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|82|31:80">
<form.text>Any additional or successor Trustee (including a Successor Corporate Trustee) may exercise all the power and authority vested in the original Trustees or the Original Corporate Trustee, as the case may be.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>6</designator>
<name>Bond.</name>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|82|31:80">
<form.text>No Trustee (individual or corporate, original or successor) shall be required to furnish any bond or undertaking or security for such Trustee's good behavior as such.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|82|31:80">
<form.text>It is intended that this shall be a permanent Trust. It may, nevertheless, be terminated or amended at any time by the Settlor, by instrument in writing, delivered to the Corporate Trustee, provided, however, that upon termination the principal of the Trust Fund and any income then undistributed shall be paid over to such organizations qualified under ARTICLE II hereof as the Individual Trustees, in their absolute discretion, shall deem appropriate to carry out the expressed purposes of this Agreement. If there shall, at any time, be no Corporate Trustee serving by reason of the Settlor's failure to appoint a successor within <inline.instr>__lsqb__number of days__rsqb__</inline.instr> days after the resignation or removal of a Corporate Trustee, then the acting Individual Trustees (or, if there are none, the Supreme Court of the State of New York) shall appoint a successor Corporate Trustee. If there shall be, at any time, no Individual Trustee serving by reason of the Settlor's failure to appoint successors, then the Corporate Trustee may, in its absolute discretion, consider the Trust terminated and make a similar distribution of principal and income of the Trust or, in its discretion, appoint two or more individual trustees. In no event shall any principal or income from this Trust revert to the Settlor, (as such term is defined in ARTICLE IV(1) of this Agreement), but any principal or income that would otherwise revert to the Settlor shall be distributed to the <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of fund__rsqb__</inline.instr>; nor shall any distribution or amendment be made that will affect, impair, or remove the restrictions on income or principal distributions or reverters contained in ARTICLE II or this ARTICLE VII or impair or destroy the tax-exempt status of this Trust or result in denying tax-exempt status to donations made to the Trust, to the extent allowed by the provisions of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 and other applicable legislation and regulations; nor shall any amendments be made that will increase the obligations of the Trustees or deny compensation to the Corporate Trustee without their and its consent.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|82|31:80">
 <form.text>Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained in this Agreement, all assets (whether principal or income) shall be distributed in such way upon occurrence of any event described in <st>Section 507 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986</st> that neither such occurrence nor such distribution shall attract any tax under <st>Section 507 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986</st>.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|82|31:80">
<form.text>This Agreement and the Trust hereby created shall be administered, construed, and enforced according to the laws of the State of New York. All donations to the Trust shall be deemed to take place in the State of New York.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|82|31:80">
<form.text>The Agreement has been executed in <inline.instr>__lsqb__number of original counterparts__rsqb__</inline.instr> counterparts, each of which shall be deemed to be the original, although the others shall not be produced.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|82|31:80">
<form.text>In Witnesseth Whereof, this instrument has been executed at <inline.instr>__lsqb__place of execution__rsqb__</inline.instr>, as of the <inline.instr>__lsqb__date of agreement__rsqb__</inline.instr>, by <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of settlor__rsqb__</inline.instr>, <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of corporate trustee__rsqb__</inline.instr> and the Individual Trustees hereinabove named.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|82|31:80">
<form.text>The Agreement has been executed in <inline.instr>__lsqb__number of original counterparts__rsqb__</inline.instr> counterparts, each of which shall be deemed to be the original, although the others shall not be produced.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|82|31:80">
<form.text>In Witnesseth Whereof, this instrument has been executed at <inline.instr>__lsqb__place of execution__rsqb__</inline.instr>, as of the <inline.instr>__lsqb__date of agreement__rsqb__</inline.instr>, by <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of settlor__rsqb__</inline.instr>, <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of corporate trustee__rsqb__</inline.instr> and the Individual Trustees hereinabove named.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
<form.line align="l">
______________
<inline.instr>&lsqb;Name of settlor&rsqb;</inline.instr>
</form.line>
<signature.block ref="manual">
<signature.group position="r">
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
<form.line align="l">
<inline.instr>&lsqb;Seal&rsqb;</inline.instr>
</form.line>
</signature.group>
<signature.group position="r">
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
<form.line align="l">
<inline.instr>&lsqb;Name of corporate trustee&rsqb;</inline.instr>
</form.line>
<form.line align="l" lineover="y">
<inline.instr>&lsqb;Name of president&rsqb;</inline.instr>
</form.line>
<form.line align="l" lineover="y">
<inline.instr>&lsqb;Name of secretary&rsqb;</inline.instr>
</form.line>
<form.line align="l" lineover="y">
</form.line>

</form.line>

</form.line>
</signature.group>
</signature.block>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|82|31:80">
<para.text>
This agreement will create a private foundation under <st>Section 509 of the Internal Revenue Code</st> with attendant 2% excise tax and reporting requirements resulting in additional administration expenses and restrictions.
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|82|31:80">
<para.text>
The transfer to a private foundation contemplated by this form may also affect the amount of the charitable deduction available to the Settlor: (1) if appreciated property is transferred by any Settlor, whether individual or corporate; or (2) if by an individual, when the maximum amount of the charitable deduction will be lower than in the case of a contribution not made to a private foundation.
</para.text>
</para>
</note.group>
