<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|24|31:24">
<para.text>
<st>26 C.F.R. &sect;1.507-2(b)(3)</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text>Abatement of tax on termination of private foundation status, <rc>Federal Tax Coordinator 2d (RIA) &para;D-7234</rc>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text>Termination of foundation, <rc>Federal Tax Guide to Legal Forms &sect;10:118</rc>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</footnote.body>
</footnote>
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|24|31:24">
<para.text>
(1) the name and address of the private foundation;
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|24|31:24">
<para.text>
(2) its intention to terminate its private foundation status;
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|24|31:24">
<para.text>
(3) the Code section under which it seeks classification (Section 509(a)(1) to (3));
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|24|31:24">
<para.text>
(4) if Section 509(a)(1) is applicable, the clause of Section 170(b)(1)(A) involved;
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|24|31:24">
<para.text>
(5) the date its regular taxable year begins; and
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|24|31:24">
<para.text>
(6) the date of commencement of the five-year period.
</para.text>
</para>
</section.body>
</section>
</section.block>
</analytical.level.body>
<analytical.level>
<front>
<outline.name.block>

</outline.name.block>

</outline.name.block>
<online.view>

</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Ic7036190181b11e68c12afa7f3a24041">
<form.name.block>
<name>MINUTES OF THE FIRST MEETING OF INCORPORATORS OF <inline.instr>__lsqb__NAME OF CORPORATION__rsqb__</inline.instr></name>
</form.name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|31|31:30">
<form.text>
On <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__date of meeting__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr>, at <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__time of meeting__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr>, at <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__place of meeting__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr>, <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__name of city__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr>, <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__name of county__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr>, <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__name of state__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr>, a meeting of the following-named persons was held: <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__names of incorporators__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr>.
</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|31|31:30">
<form.text>
The meeting was called to order by <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__name of presiding officer__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr>, who presided over the elections of officers of the meeting. By motion duly made, seconded, and carried, <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__name of chairperson__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr> was elected chair of the meeting and <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__name of secretary__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr> was elected Secretary.
</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|31|31:30">
<form.text>
 <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__Name of chairperson__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr> then announced that the object of the meeting was to take such steps as might be necessary to organize a not-for-profit charitable corporation under the <st>Not-for-Profit Corporation Law of the State of New York</st>, to be known as <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__name of corporation__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr>, which would qualify for income tax exemption under <st>Section 501(c)(3) of the Federal Internal Revenue Code</st>.
</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|31|31:30">
<form.text>
<inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__Name of chairperson__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr> presented a draft of the certificate of incorporation of <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__name of corporation__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr>. The draft was then unanimously approved by the proposed incorporators, <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__names of incorporators__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr>, all of whom signed the same in the manner required by law. A copy of the certificate of incorporation so presented and approved is attached.
</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|31|31:30">
<form.text>
By motion duly made, seconded, and unanimously carried, the Secretary was directed to follow the statutory procedure for obtaining the approval of the Supreme Court of the <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__identification of judicial district__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr> of the above certificate and, upon obtaining such approval, to file the certificate of incorporation in the office of the Secretary of State of the State of New York.
</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|31|31:30">
<form.text>
There being no further business to come before the meeting, upon motion duly made, seconded, and unanimously carried, the meeting was adjourned.
</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.line align="l">
<inline.instr>&lsqb;Name of corporation&rsqb;</inline.instr>
</form.line>
<signature.block ref="manual">
<signature.group position="r">
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>

</form.line>

</form.line>

</form.line>
<form.line align="l">
<inline.instr>&lsqb;date of meeting&rsqb;</inline.instr>
</form.line>
</signature.group>
<signature.group position="r">
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
<form.line align="l" lineover="y">
</form.line>
<form.line align="l" lineover="y">

</form.line>
</signature.group>
</signature.block>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|31|31:30">
<para.text>
Although the corporation does not come into existence until the certificate is filed by the Department of State (see <st>N-PCL &sect;403</st>), the incorporators may take preliminary steps to organize the corporation. See <x>&dblsect;17:1 et seq.</x>
</para.text>
</para>
</note.group>

</outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>

</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Ic70388a0181b11e68c12afa7f3a24041">
<form.name.block>
<name>CONSENT TO ACTION TAKEN IN LIEU OF THE ORGANIZATION MEETING OF <inline.instr>__lsqb__NAME OF CORPORATION__rsqb__</inline.instr></name>
</form.name.block>
<form.line align="l">
</form.line>
<signature.block ref="manual">
<signature.group position="r">
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
</signature.group>
</signature.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|32|31:31">
<form.text>
The undersigned, being the President of the Corporation, hereby consents to the action taken, as hereafter stated, in lieu of the organization meeting:
</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|32|31:31">
<form.text>
A copy of the certificate of incorporation together with the receipt issued by the Department of State showing the date and payment of the filing fee for the original certificate of incorporation was appended to this statement.
</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|32|31:31">
<form.text>
By<trace>l</trace>aws regulating the conduct and the affairs of the corporation, as prepared by <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__name of law firm__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr>, attorneys for the corporation, were adopted and ordered appended thereto.
</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|32|31:31">
<form.text>
The following persons were appointed directors of the corporation: <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__names of directors__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr>.
</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|32|31:31">
<form.text>
The principal office of the corporation was fixed at <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__address of office__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr>, <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__name of city__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr>, New York <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__specification of ZIP code__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr>.
</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|32|31:31">
<form.text>
<inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__Name of depository__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr>, located at <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__address of depository__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr>, <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__name of city__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr>, New York <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__specification of ZIP code__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr>, was designated as depository for bank accounts in the name of the corporation, with <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__titles of officers__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr> as authorized signatories.
</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.line align="l">
</form.line>
<signature.block ref="manual">
<signature.group position="r">
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
<form.line align="l">
Dated:
<inline.instr>&lsqb;date of consent&rsqb;</inline.instr>
</form.line>
</signature.group>
<signature.group position="r">
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
<form.line align="l" lineover="y">
<inline.instr>&lsqb;Name of president&rsqb;</inline.instr>
</form.line>

<section date.trace="1">
<section.front><outline.name.block>
<label>&sect;</label>
<designator>31:31.40</designator>
<name>Statement of incorporator in lieu of organization al meeting</name>
</outline.name.block>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form date.updated="1" date.trace="1">
<form.name.block>
<name>STATEMENT OF INCORPORATOR IN LIEU OF ORGANIZATIONAL MEETING OF <inline.instr>[NAME OF CORPORATION]</inline.instr></name>
</form.name.block>
</form>
<p>The certificate of incorporation of the above-named corporation having been filed in the</trace>
<form.para date.updated="1" date.trace="1">
<form.text>Office of the Secretary of State of the State of New York, the undersigned, being the incorporator named in said certificate, does hereby state that the following actions were taken on this day for the purpose of organizing this corporation:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para date.updated="1" date.trace="1">
<form.text>1. Bylaws for the regulation of the affairs of the corporation were adopted by the undersigned incorporator and were ordered inserted in the minute book immediately following the copy of the certificate of incorporation and before this instrument.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para date.updated="1" date.trace="1">
<form.text>2. The undersigned hereby resigns as incorporator of the corporation as of the date set forth below and the following are hereby elected as the directors of the corporation to hold office until the first annual meeting of the corporation or until their successors are elected and qualified: <inline.instr>[list of names of directors]</inline.instr></form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para date.updated="1" date.trace="1">
<form.text>Dated: <inline.instr>[date of signature]</inline.instr></form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para date.updated="1" date.trace="1">
<form.text><inline.instr>[Name of incorporator]</inline.instr></form.text>
</form.para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text> <tk>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3370 to 3379</tk></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text><tk>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;337 4</tk></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text>31 : 31.50. Resolution approving certificate of incorporation
<reference.entry><ref.text>RESOLVED, to ratify confirm, authorize, approve and accept the filing of the Certificate of Incorporation of the Corporation, a true and complete copy of which is appended hereto as Exhibit <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__designation of exhibit__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr>, with the Department of State of the State of New York, and all actions heretofore taken to effect the formation of the Corporation.
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<reference.entry><ref.text>Research References
</note.group>
</note.block>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block>
<label>&sect;</label>
<designator>31:32</designator>
<name>Certificate of incorporation<sep/> Official form</name>
</outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>

</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Ic703d6c0181b11e68c12afa7f3a24041">
<image.block ct.id="UNKNOWN_CT_ID">
<image ident="I00FFZJ"/>
<image ident="I00GLA0"/>
<image ident="I00GMGN"/>
<image ident="I00HZAB"/>
<image ident="I00I0GW"/>
</image.block>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|33|31:32">
<para.text>
The above form, revised 12/22, is available from the New York State Department of State, <url>http://www.dos.ny.gov</url>, and is reprinted here for illustrative purposes.
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|33|31:32">
<para.text>
The required contents of a certificate of incorporation are set forth in <st>N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corp. Law &sect;402(a)</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|33|31:32">
<para.text>
The certificate of incorporation may set forth any provision not inconsistent with the New York Not-for-Profit Corporation Law or any other statute of the state which provision is (1) for the regulation of the internal affairs of the corporation, including types or classes of membership and the distribution of assets on dissolution or final liquidation, or (2) required by any governmental body or officer or other person or body as a condition for giving the consent or approval required for filing the certificate of incorporation. <st>N-PCL &sect;402(c).</st>
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|33|31:32">
<para.text>
The certificate must be signed by each incorporator, with each incorporator's name and address included in the certificate and delivered to the Department of State, together with any filing fees. <st>N-PCL &sect;402(a)</st>. For a listing of such fees, see <st>N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corp. Law &sect;104-a</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|33|31:32">
<para.text>
For other forms and materials related to the drafting of a certificate of incorporation, see <x>Corporations &dblsect;17:1 et seq.</x> and <x>Social and Recreation Nonprofit Organizations &dblsect;30:1 et seq.</x>
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|33|31:32">
<para.text>
For a discussion of the incorporation of charitable organizations and the formal requirements, see <x>&dblsect;31:4 et seq.</x>.
</para.text>
</para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><tk>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3370 to 3379</tk></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><rc>Distribution of funds by nonprofit corporation absent dissolution, 51 A.L.R.3d 1318</rc></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
<form.name.block>Paragraph First.</form.name.block>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|33|31:32">
<para.text>
The corporate name must be distinct and must not violate other statutory requirements. <st>N-PCL &sect;301.</st> The corporate name may be reserved under a statutory procedure. <st>N-PCL &sect;303.</st> The corporate name may be in a language other than English if it is written in English letters or characters. <st>N-PCL &sect;104(a).</st> The corporation may not use a name other than the name that appears in the certificate of incorporation without following the procedures to use an assumed name. <st>N-PCL &sect;202(f).</st>
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|33|31:32">
<para.text>
For a discussion of the procedures for using an assumed name, see <x>&dblsect;21:1 et seq.</x>.
</para.text>
</para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><rc>Right of charitable or religious association or corporation to protection against use of same or similar name by another, 37 A.L.R.3d 277</rc></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text><rc>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;164 to 176</rc></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
<form.name.block>Paragraph Second.</form.name.block>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|33|31:32">
<para.text>
The language incorporating the statutory definition of a not-for-profit corporation is required by statute. <st>N-PCL &sect;402(a)(2).</st>
</para.text>
</para>
<form.name.block>Paragraph Third.</form.name.block>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|33|31:32">
<para.text>
The specific purpose(s) for which the corporation is organized must be stated in the certificate of incorporation, it being sufficient to state that the purpose of the corporation is any purpose for which corporations may be organized under the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law. <st>N-PCL &sect;402(a)(2).</st>
</para.text>
</para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text><rc>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;57, 58</rc></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
<form.name.block>Paragraph Sixth.</form.name.block>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|33|31:32">
<para.text>
The certificate of incorporation must state the county within New York State in which the office of the corporation is to be located. If the office at which the books and records of the corporation will be kept is outside the state, the certificate may identify the post office address of the office. <st>N-PCL &sect;402(a)(3).</st>
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|33|31:32">
<para.text>
The corporation must keep correct and complete books and records of account and minutes of the proceedings of its members, board, and executive committee, if any, at its office. This office may be outside the state if the certificate of incorporation so states. The corporation also must keep a list of its members and their interests in the corporation at its office or at the office of its transfer agent or registrar in New York State. <st>N-PCL &sect;621.</st>
</para.text>
</para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text><rc>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;369</rc></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
<form.name.block>Paragraph Seventh.</form.name.block>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|33|31:32">
<para.text>
Except as otherwise provided in the certificate of incorporation, the corporation is managed by its board of directors. <st>N-PCL §701(a).</st> A director is any member of the governing board of a corporation, whether designated as director, trustee, manager, governor, or by any other title. <st>N-PCL §102(6).</st> Any person who has the same role as a director in a corporation is subject to the same obligations and liabilities as is imposed on a director for managerial acts or omissions. <st>N-PCL §701(b).</st>
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|33|31:32">
<para.text>
The number of directors cannot be less than three and may be fixed by the bylaws or by a procedure stated in the bylaws. <st>N-PCL &sect;702(a)</st>. The certificate of incorporation must state the names and addresses of the initial directors. <st>N-PCL &sect;402(a)(4)</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|33|31:32">
<para.text>
Each director must be at least 18 years of age except for directors in certain statutorily designated youth organizations. <st>N-PCL §701(a).</st> The certificate of incorporation or bylaws may prescribe other qualifications for directors. <st>N-PCL §701(a).</st>
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|33|31:32">
<para.text>
The directors may be elected or appointed in the manner and for the term specified in the certificate of incorporation or the bylaws. <st>N-PCL &sect;703(b).</st> In the absence of a provision fixing the term of office of a director, the term is one year and, with certain exceptions specified by statute, cannot exceed five years. <st>N-PCL &sect;703(b).</st> Directors must hold office until the expiration of the term or until a successor is appointed. <st>N-PCL &sect;703(c).</st> Matters as to election or appointment of directors and their terms of office that may be specified in the certificate of incorporation or bylaws include:
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|33|31:32">
<para.text>
(1) Election or appointment of directors at large, or by special districts or membership sections, or by virtue of a director's office or former office in the corporation or other public or private entity, or by bondholders voting as a class, or any combination thereof. <st>N-PCL &sect;703(a).</st>
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|33|31:32">
<para.text>
(2) Election or appointment of alternate directors if the certificate of incorporation or bylaws provide for appointment or election by special district or by membership section. <st>N-PCL &sect;703(d).</st>
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|33|31:32">
<para.text>
(3) Staggering the terms of the board members. <st>N-PCL &sect;704.</st>
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|33|31:32">
<para.text>
(4) Electing or appointing directors to newly created directorships or to fill vacancies on the board of directors. <st>N-PCL &sect;705.</st>
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|33|31:32">
<para.text>
(5) Restricting the members' right to remove a director without cause. <st>N-PCL &sect;706(b)</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|33|31:32">
<para.text>
(6) Making the number of directors that constitute a quorum more or less than a majority of the board of directors. <st>N-PCL &dblsect;707, 709(a)(1).</st>
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|33|31:32">
<para.text>
(7) Prohibiting the board of directors from acting without a formal meeting. <st>N-PCL §708(b)</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|33|31:32">
<para.text>
(8) Authorizing directors to participate in board or committee meetings by conference telephone or similar communications equipment or by electronic video screen communication. <st>N-PCL &sect;708(c)</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|33|31:32">
<para.text>
(9) Altering the proportion of directors' votes necessary to transact all or specific types of business. <st>N-PCL &sect;709(a)(2)</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|33|31:32">
<para.text>
(10) Specifying the place of annual, regular, or special meetings of the board of directors. <st>N-PCL §710(a).</st>
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|33|31:32">
<para.text>
(11) Allowing committees of directors to act on behalf of the board of directors (except as to matters stated in the statute). <st>N-PCL &sect;712.</st>
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|33|31:32">
<para.text>
(12) Advancing or indemnifying directors for expenses. See <st>N-PCL &sect;721.</st>
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|33|31:32">
<para.text>
The certificate of incorporation may contain restrictions on contracts or transactions between the corporation and its directors. <st>N-PCL §715(d)</st>. Unless provided otherwise in the certificate of incorporation or bylaws, the board fixes the compensation of the directors for services in any capacity. <st>N-PCL §715(e)</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text><rc>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;71</rc></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text><rc>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;527 to 607</rc></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text><rc>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;683 et seq</rc>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
<form.name.block>Paragraph Eighth.</form.name.block>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|33|31:32">
<para.text>
The certificate of incorporation must designate the Secretary of State as agent of the corporation upon whom process against it may be served and must designate the post office address to which the Secretary is to mail a copy of process against the corporation served on him or her. <trace>The corporation may include an email address to which the secretary of state shall email a notice of the fact that process against it has been electronically served upon him or her. </trace><st>N-PCL &sect;402(a)(6)</st>. The Secretary is deemed to be the agent for service of process on a corporation. <st>N-PCL &sect;304</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
<trace.deleted/>
<trace.deleted/>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text><rc>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;71, 1062, 1063</rc></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
</form>
</section.body>
</section>
<section date.trace="1">
<section.front><outline.name.block>
<label>&sect;</label>
<designator>31:32</designator>
<name>10 Certificate of incorporation —Private foundation </name>
</outline.name.block>
</section.front>
<section.body><form>

<head date.updated="1" date.trace="1">
<name.block>
<name>CERTIFICATE OF INCORPORATION OF <inline.instr>[NAME OF CORPORATION]</inline.instr></name>
</name.block>
</head>
<head date.updated="1" date.trace="1">
<name.block>
<name>Under <st>Section 402 of the Not-For-Profit Corporation Law</st></name>
</name.block>
</head>
<form.para date.updated="1" date.trace="1">
<form.text>The undersigned, being a natural person of at least eighteen years of age and acting as the incorporator of the corporation being formed under the <st>New York Not-for-Profit Corporation Law</st>, certifies that:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para date.updated="1" date.trace="1">
<form.text>1. Name. The name of the corporation (hereinafter, the "Corporation") is: <inline.instr>[name of corporation]</inline.instr></form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para date.updated="1" date.trace="1">
<form.text>2. The Corporation is a corporation as defined in <st>Subparagraph (5) of Paragraph (a) of Section 102 of the New York Not-for-Profit Corporation Law</st>.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para date.updated="1" date.trace="1">
<form.text>3. Purposes. The Corporation is formed for the following purposes:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para date.updated="1" date.trace="1">
<form.text>(a)To plan, develop, and operate a <inline.instr>[specification of event]</inline.instr> to raise and distribute funds to charitable organizations that perform medical research and combat diseases, disorders, and other medical disciplines.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para date.updated="1" date.trace="1">
<form.text>(b)To receive and maintain a fund or funds of real or personal property including, without limitation, cash contributions and, subject to the restrictions and limitations set forth in this certificate of incorporation, to use and apply the income and principal for the Corporation's purposes and activities;</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para date.updated="1" date.trace="1">
<form.text>(c) To do any other act or thing incidental to or connected with the Corporation's purposes and activities, but not for the pecuniary profit or financial gain of any of the Corporation's members, trustees, directors or officers, except as permitted under <st>Article 5 of the New York Not-for-Profit Corporation Law</st>, or as permitted in <x>Section 7(a)</x> of this certificate of incorporation; and</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para date.updated="1" date.trace="1">
<form.text>(d) To have in furtherance of its not-for-profit corporate purposes all of the powers conferred upon corporations organized under the <st>New York Not-for-Profit Corporation Law</st> subject to any limitations contained in this certificate of incorporation or in the laws of the State of New York.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para date.updated="1" date.trace="1">
<form.text>4.Prohibition on Certain Political Activities. Notwithstanding the foregoing, no substantial part of the activities of the Corporation will be the carrying on of propaganda, or otherwise attempting to influence legislation through improper means, and no part of its activities will entail the participation or intervention in any political campaign by any means, including the publication or distribution of statements on behalf of (or in opposition to) any candidate for public office, nor will the Corporation engage in any activity which would, in the opinion of the directors, jeopardize an exemption from federal income taxation under <st>section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986</st> (the "Code") and the regulations promulgated thereunder.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para date.updated="1" date.trace="1">
<form.text>5.State Approval. The Corporation is not formed to engage in any activity or of any purpose requiring consent or approval of any state official, department, board, agency or other body. No consent or approval is required.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para date.updated="1" date.trace="1">
<form.text>6.Charitable Corporation. The Corporation is a charitable corporation under <st>Section 201 of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law</st>.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para date.updated="1" date.trace="1">
<form.text>7.Restrictions on Use of Earnings and on Distributions.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para date.updated="1" date.trace="1">
<form.text>(a)No part of the net earnings of the Corporation shall inure to the benefit of any member, trustee, director or officer of the Corporation, or any private individual, except that reasonable compensation may be paid to any of the foregoing persons for services rendered to or for the Corporation; and no member, trustee, director or officer of the Corporation, or any private individual, shall be entitled to share in the distribution of any of the Corporation's assets upon dissolution of the Corporation.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para date.updated="1" date.trace="1">
<form.text>(b)The Corporation shall distribute its income for each taxable year at a time and in a manner that will not result in the Corporation becoming subject to the tax on undistributed income imposed by <st>section 4942 of the Code</st>.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para date.updated="1" date.trace="1">
<form.text>(c)In the event of the dissolution of the Corporation, all of the remaining assets and property of the Corporation, after payment of the necessary expenses, shall be distributed, as the board of directors of the Corporation determines, to another organization or organizations exempt under <st>section 501(c)(3) of the Code</st>, to the federal government, or to state or local government or government agencies operating for a public benefit or a public purpose, subject to any requisite approval and/or jurisdiction of the Supreme Court of the State of New York.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para date.updated="1" date.trace="1">
<form.text>8.Prohibitions on Certain Other Activities.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para date.updated="1" date.trace="1">
<form.text>(a)The Corporation shall not: (i) engage in any act of self-dealing as defined in <st>section 4941 of the Code</st>; (ii) retain any excess business holdings as defined in <st>section 4943 of the Code</st>; (iii) make any investments in such manner as to subject it to tax under <st>section 4944 of the Code</st>; or (iv) make any taxable expenditures as defined in <st>section 4945 of the Code</st>.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para date.updated="1" date.trace="1">
<form.text>(b)Without limiting the provisions of <x>section 8(a)</x> of this certificate of incorporation, the Corporation is organized exclusively for one or more of the exempt purposes as specified in <st>section 501(c)(3) of the Code</st> and shall not carry on any other activities not permitted to be carried on by (i) a corporation exempt from federal income tax under <st>section 501(c)(3) of the Code</st> and the regulations promulgated thereunder, or (ii) by a corporation to which contributions are deductible under <st>section 170(c)(2) of the Code</st>. Nothing herein contained shall authorize this corporation, directly or indirectly, to engage in or include among its purposes, any of the activities mentioned in <st>Section 404(b) through (v) of the Not-For-Profit Corporation Law</st>.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para date.updated="1" date.trace="1">
<form.text>9.Office. The office of the Corporation is to be located in the County of <inline.instr>[name of county]</inline.instr>, State of New York.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para date.updated="1" date.trace="1">
<form.text>10.Agent for Service of Process. The Secretary of State of the State of New York is hereby designated the agent of the Corporation upon whom process against it may be served. The post office address to which the Secretary of State shall mail a copy of any process against the Corporation served upon him or her as agent of the Corporation is: <inline.instr>[name and address of agent]</inline.instr></form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para date.updated="1" date.trace="1">
<form.text>11.Indemnification of Directors and Officers. If a director or officer of the Corporation is made a party to any civil or criminal action, suit or proceeding in any matter arising from the performance of his or her duties for or on behalf of the Corporation, then to the fullest extent permitted by law, the Corporation shall indemnify the director or officer for all amounts paid by him or her in connection with the action, suit or proceeding, including any judgments, fines, amounts paid in settlement and reasonable expenses, including attorneys' fees and expenses.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para date.updated="1" date.trace="1">
<form.text>12.Initial Directors. The name and the address of each of the initial directors of the Corporation are as follows: <inline.instr>[names and addresses of initial directors]</inline.instr></form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para date.updated="1" date.trace="1">
<form.text>13.Duration. The duration of the Corporation shall be perpetual.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para date.updated="1" date.trace="1">
<form.text>14.Private Foundation. During such periods, if any, as the Corporation shall be a "private foundation," as that term is defined in the Code, the Corporation shall operate subject to the following restrictions:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para date.updated="1" date.trace="1">
<form.text>(a)The Corporation shall distribute such amounts for each taxable year at such times and in such manner as not to subject the Corporation to tax on undistributed income under <st>Section 4942 of the Code</st> (or any successor provision thereof) ;</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para date.updated="1" date.trace="1">
<form.text>(b)The Corporation shall not engage in any act of self-dealing which is subject to tax under <st>Section 4941 of the Code</st> (or any successor provision thereof);</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para date.updated="1" date.trace="1">
<form.text>(c)The Corporation shall not retain any excess business holdings as to subject the Corporation to tax under <st>Section 4943 of the Code</st> (or any successor provision thereof);</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para date.updated="1" date.trace="1">
<form.text>(d)The Corporation shall not make any investments in such manner as to subject the corporation to tax under <st>Section 4944 of the Code</st> (or any successor provision thereof); and</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para date.updated="1" date.trace="1">
<form.text>(e)The Corporation shall not make any taxable expenditures, as defined in <st>Section 4945(d) of the Code</st> (or any successor provision thereof).</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para date.updated="1" date.trace="1">
<form.text>15.References to Internal Revenue Code, Etc. Every reference in this certificate of incorporation to the Code, or to any provision thereof or regulation thereunder, shall include every amendment thereto and every corresponding federal law, provision or regulation that may be subsequently enacted or promulgated.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para date.updated="1" date.trace="1">
<form.text>IN WITNESS WHEREOF, I hereunto sign my name and affirm that the statements made herein are true under the penalties of perjury, this <inline.instr>[ordinal number of day]</inline.instr> day of <inline.instr>[name of month]</inline.instr> <inline.instr>[identification of year]</inline.instr>.</form.text>
</form.para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text> <tk>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3370 to 3379</tk></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
</form></section.body>
</section>
<section date.trace="1">
<section.front><outline.name.block>
<label>&sect;</label>
<designator>31:32.50</designator>
<name>Certificate of incorporation—Provision—Purpose</name>
</outline.name.block>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form.para date.updated="1" date.trace="1">
<form.text>The Corporation is formed for the following purpose or purposes:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para date.updated="1" date.trace="1">
<form.text>The Corporation is organized exclusively for charitable, religious, educational, and/or scientific purposes, including, for such purposes, the making of distributions to organizations that qualify as exempt organizations under <st>Section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code</st>, or the corresponding section of any future federal tax code.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para date.updated="1" date.trace="1">
<form.text>The Corporation will be operated to promote and engage in general charitable activities and will received funds or real or personal property to be applied in whole or in any part of the income therefrom and the principal thereof exclusively for charitable, religious, literary or educational purposes either directly or by contributions to organizations that qualify as exempt organizations under <st>Section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code</st>.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para date.updated="1" date.trace="1">
<form.text>The Corporation will solicit funds and accept contributions for the afore mentioned purposes.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para date.updated="1" date.trace="1">
<form.text>To have in furtherance of its not-for-profit corporate purposes, the Corporation will have all of the powers conferred upon corporations organized under the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law subject to any limitations thereof contained in this Certificate of Incorporation or in the laws of the State of New York.</form.text>
</form.para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text><tk>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3373</tk></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
</section.body>
</section>
<section date.trace="1">
<section.front><outline.name.block>
<label>&sect;</label>
<designator>31:3 2</designator>
<name>6 0 Certificate of incorporation — Provision — Purpose <sep/>Women’s rights</name>
</outline.name.block>
</section.front>
<section.body><form>

<form.para date.updated="1" date.trace="1">
<form.text>The specific and primary purpose for which the Corporation is formed is:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para date.updated="1" date.trace="1">
<form.text>(a) To make grants to women's rights organizations in developing countries that help women gain freedom from poverty, violence, and discrimination;</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para date.updated="1" date.trace="1">
<form.text>(b) and to operate exclusively in any other manner for such charitable and educational purposes as will qualify it as an exempt organization under <st>Section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code</st>, or under any corresponding provisions of any subsequent federal tax laws, covering the distributions to organizations qualified as tax exempt organizations under the Internal Revenue Codes including private foundations and private operating foundations.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para date.updated="1" date.trace="1">
<form.text>2. The Corporation will have and exercise all rights and powers conferred upon corporation s under the laws of the State of New York; provided, however, that the Corporation is not empowered to engage in any activity that, in itself, is not in furtherance of its purposes as set forth in subparagraphs (a) and (b) of this article.</form.text>
</form.para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text><tk>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3373</tk></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
</form></section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block>
<label>&sect;</label>
<designator>31:33</designator>
<name>Certificate of incorporation<sep/> Provision<sep/> Directors to constitute sole membership of corporation; rights and liabilities of members</name>
</outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>CLS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>EBL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Ic70424e0181b11e68c12afa7f3a24041">
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(a)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|34|31:33">
<form.text>The sole class of members of this corporation shall be its directors.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(b)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|34|31:33">
<form.text>The members of this corporation shall have no right, title, or interest whatsoever in its income, property, or assets, nor shall any portion of such income, property, or assets be distributed to any member on the dissolution or winding up of this corporation. Members of this corporation shall not be personally liable for the debts, liabilities, or obligations of the corporation and shall not be subject to any assessments.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|34|31:33" date.trace="1">
<para.text>
A not-for-profit corporation may have one or more classes of members or, in the case of a charitable corporation, may have no members. <st>N-PCL &sect;601(a)</st>
</para.text>
</para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><tk>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3401</tk></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text><rc>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;71</rc></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text><rc>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;527 to 607</rc></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text><rc>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &dblsect;683 et seq</rc>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
</form>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block>
<label>&sect;</label>
<designator>31:34</designator>
<name>Certificate of incorporation<sep/> Provision<sep/> Article required to qualify for federal income tax exemption</name>
</outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>CLS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>EBL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Ic7044bf0181b11e68c12afa7f3a24041">
<form.para>
<form.text>Internal Revenue Code Section 501(c)(3), including, for such purposes, the making of distributions to organizations that qualify as tax-exempt organizations under such Code.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|35|31:34">
<form.text>
This corporation shall not, as a substantial part of its activities, carry on propaganda or otherwise attempt to influence legislation. This corporation shall not participate in or intervene in (including the publishing or distributing of statements) any political campaign on behalf of any candidate for public office.
</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|35|31:34">
<form.text>
No part of the net earnings, properties, or assets of this corporation, on dissolution or otherwise, shall inure to the benefit of any private person or individual or any member or director of this corporation. On liquidation or dissolution, all properties and assets of this corporation remaining after paying or providing for all debts and obligations shall be distributed and paid over to such fund, foundation, or corporation organized and operated for charitable or religious purposes as the board of directors shall determine and as shall, at the time, qualify as a tax-exempt organization under <st>Internal Revenue Code Section 501(c)(3)</st> or as the same may be amended.
</form.text>
</form.para>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="taxnotes">
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|35|31:34">
<para.text>
Corporations and any community chest, fund, or foundation organized and operated exclusively for religious, charitable, scientific, testing for public safety, literary, or educational purposes, or to foster national or international amateur sports competition (but only if no part of its activities involve the provision of athletic facilities or equipment), or for the prevention of cruelty to children or animals, no part of the net earnings of which inures to the benefit of any private shareholder or individual, no substantial part of the activities of which is carrying on propaganda or otherwise attempting to influence legislation and which does not participate in or intervene in (including the publishing or distributing of statements) any political campaign on behalf of any candidate for public office, are exempt from taxation on their income. <st>26 U.S.C.A. &sect;501(c)(3)</st>; <st>26 C.F.R. &sect;1.501(c)(3)-1</st>. For such an organization to be exempt, it must be organized and operated exclusively for one or more of the purposes specified in the exemption statute, and, if it fails to meet either the organizational test or the operational test, it is not exempt. <st>26 C.F.R. &sect;1.501(c)(3)-1(a)(1)</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|35|31:34">
<para.text>
The provisions contained in the above form cover the general requirements imposed on organizations seeking tax-exempt status under <st>Section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code</st>. Depending on the nature of the organization, other requirements may also be imposed. The exact section of the Code governing the particular type of organization formed will determine any further qualifications. If these exist, they, too, should be included in the certificate.
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|35|31:34">
<para.text>
Although the form starts with the words “Anything in this certificate of incorporation to the contrary notwithstanding ...,” the purposes stated should be only one or more of the exempt purposes allowed under the Code. Powers and purposes beyond those will lead to rejection of the exempt status even if an exempt purpose is pleaded under the “to the contrary notwithstanding” phrase.
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|35|31:34">
<para.text>
The incorporation of this provision into the certificate of incorporation of a corporation organized for charitable purposes should enable the corporation to claim an exemption from taxation of income by making the corporation an exempt organization under <st>26 U.S.C.A. &sect;501(c)(3)</st>, <st>26 C.F.R. &sect;1.501(c)(3)-1</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|35|31:34">
<para.text>
For discussion concerning qualifying for exemption from federal income taxation, see <x>&dblsect;31:9 et seq.</x>
</para.text>
</para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><tk>West's Key Number Digest, Internal Revenue &key;4045 to 4079</tk></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
</form>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block>
<label>&sect;</label>
<designator>31:35</designator>
<name>Certificate of incorporation<sep/> Provision<sep/> Article required to qualify for federal income tax exemption<sep/> Private foundation</name>
</outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>CLS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>EBL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Ic7047300181b11e68c12afa7f3a24041">
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(a)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|36|31:35">
<form.text>The corporation shall distribute its income for each taxable year at such time and in such manner as not to become subject to the tax on undistributed income imposed by <st>Section 4942 of the Internal Revenue Code or corresponding provisions of any subsequent federal tax laws.</st></form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(b)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|36|31:35">
<form.text>The corporation shall not engage in any act of self-dealing as defined in <st>Section 4941(d) of the Internal Revenue Code</st> or corresponding provisions of any subsequent federal tax law.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(c)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|36|31:35">
<form.text>The corporation shall not retain any excess business holdings as defined in <st>Section 4943(c) of the Internal Revenue Code</st> or corresponding provisions of any subsequent federal tax laws.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(d)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|36|31:35">
<form.text>The corporation shall not make any investments in such manner as to subject it to tax under <st>Section 4944 of the Internal Revenue Code or corresponding provisions of any subsequent federal tax laws.</st></form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(e)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|36|31:35">
<form.text>The corporation shall not make any taxable expenditures as defined in <st>Section 4945(d) of the Internal Revenue Code</st> or corresponding provisions of any subsequent federal tax law.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="taxnotes">
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|36|31:35">
<para.text>
This provision is intended to qualify a private foundation, otherwise exempt, for exemption from federal income taxation under <st>26 U.S.C.A. &sect;508(e)</st> and has specifically been held adequate for that purpose by the Internal Revenue Service. <st>Rev. Rul. 70-270, 1970-1 C.B. 135.</st>
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|36|31:35">
<para.text>
If a disqualified person engages in self-dealing with a trust, that person is subject to a 10% tax that goes up to 200% if the self-dealing is not rectified. <st>26 U.S.C.A. &sect;4941</st>. A disqualified person is one or more of the following: (See <st>26 U.S.C.A. &sect;4946(a)</st>.)
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|36|31:35">
<para.text>
1) a substantial contributor;
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|36|31:35">
<para.text>
2) a foundation manager;
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|36|31:35">
<para.text>
3) a person who owns more than 20% of a corporation, partnership, trust, or unincorporated enterprise which is itself a substantial contributor; and/or
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|36|31:35">
<para.text>
4) a member of the family of any individual of the first three categories.
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|36|31:35">
<para.text>
Self-dealing includes certain financial transactions, engaged in directly or indirectly by a “disqualified person.” See <st>26 C.F.R. &sect;53.4941(d)-2</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|36|31:35">
<para.text>
For discussion of application for exemption from the foundation rules, see <x>§31:22</x>.
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|36|31:35">
<para.text>
For discussion of the requirements concerning contents of organizational documents of a private foundation, generally, see <x>§31:23</x>.
</para.text>
</para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><tk>West's Key Number Digest, Internal Revenue &key;4045 to 4079</tk></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
</form>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block>
<label>&sect;</label>
<designator>31:36</designator>
<name>Certificate of incorporation<sep/> Provision<sep/> Distribution of assets on dissolution</name>
</outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>REO</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>CLS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Ic704c120181b11e68c12afa7f3a24041">
<form.para>
<form.text>&sect;501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code, as amended. That organization shall be <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of organization__rsqb__</inline.instr> if it qualifies as a distributee under this Article. No part of the assets or property of this corporation shall be distributed to members, either for the reimbursement of any sums subscribed, donated, or contributed by members or for any other purpose, it being the intent in the event of the dissolution of this corporation, or on its ceasing to carry out the purposes of the corporation, that the property and assets then owned by the corporation shall be devoted to the following nonprofit charitable purpose: <inline.instr>__lsqb__[name of tax-exempt purpose__rsqb__</inline.instr>/<inline.instr>__lsqb__name of charitable purpose__rsqb__</inline.instr>].</form.text>
</form.para>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="taxnotes">
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|37|31:36">
<para.text>
An organization is not organized exclusively for one or more exempt purposes unless its assets are dedicated to an exempt purpose. An organization's assets will be considered dedicated to an exempt purpose, for example, if, upon dissolution, such assets would, by reason of a provision in the organization's articles or by operation of law, be distributed for one or more exempt purposes or to the federal government or to a state or local government, for a public purpose, or would be distributed by a court to another organization to be used in such manner as in the judgment of the court will best accomplish the general purposes for which the dissolved organization was organized. However, an organization does not meet the organizational test if its articles or the law of the state in which it was created provides that its assets would, upon dissolution, be distributed to its members or shareholders. <st>26 C.F.R. &sect;1.501(c)(3)-1(b)(4).</st>
</para.text>
</para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><tk>West's Key Number Digest, Charities &key;39</tk></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><tk>West's Key Number Digest, Charities &key;40</tk></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><tk>West's Key Number Digest, Charities &key;48</tk></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text><rc>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;1431</rc></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text><rc>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Charities &sect;82</rc></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><rc>Am. Jur. 2d, Corporations &sect;2470</rc></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text>Distribution of assets upon dissolution, <rc>Federal Tax Guide to Legal Forms &sect;10:94</rc></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
<trace.deleted/>
</form>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block>
<label>&sect;</label>
<designator>31:37</designator>
<name>Certificate of amendment of the certificate of incorporation<sep/> Official form</name>
</outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>EFM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Ic704e830181b11e68c12afa7f3a24041">
<image.block ct.id="UNKNOWN_CT_ID">
<image ident="I02IWZF"/>
<image ident="I02LPJ1"/>
<image ident="I02OHWT"/>
</image.block>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|38|31:37">
<para.text>
The above form, revised 3/17, is available from the New York State Department of State, <url>http://www.dos.ny.gov</url>, and is reprinted here for illustrative purposes.
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|38|31:37">
<para.text>
A certificate of amendment of a certificate of incorporation must be entitled “Certificate of Amendment of the Certificate of Incorporation of (Name of Corporation) Under <st>§803 of the Not-for-Profit Corporation Law.</st>” <st>N-PCL §803(a).</st>
</para.text>
</para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><tk>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3374</tk></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
<form.name.block>Paragraph First.</form.name.block>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|38|31:37">
<para.text>
The Certificate of Amendment must include the name of the corporation and, if the name has been changed, the name under which the corporation was formed. <st>N-PCL §803(a)(1)</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text><rc>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;154</rc></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
<form.name.block>Paragraphs Second and Third.</form.name.block>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|38|31:37">
<para.text>
The Certificate of Amendment must include the date that the certificate of incorporation was filed by the New York State Department of State and the law under which the corporation was formed. <st>N-PCL &sect;803(a)(2).</st>
</para.text>
</para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text><rc>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;154</rc></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
<trace.deleted/>
<form.name.block>Paragraph Fourth.</form.name.block>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|38|31:37">
<para.text>
N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law <st>§803(a)(3)</st> requires a statement that the corporation is a corporation as defined in <st>§102(a)(5) of the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text><rc>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;154</rc></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
<form.name.block>Paragraph Fifth.</form.name.block>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|38|31:37">
<para.text>
The Certificate of Amendment must include the subject matter of each provision of the certificate of incorporation that is to be amended or eliminated and the full text of any provision or provisions that are to be substituted or added. <st>N-PCL §803(a)(4).</st>
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|38|31:37">
<para.text>
Any one or more of the following changes may be authorized by or pursuant to authorization of the board: (1) to specify or change the location of the office of the corporation; (2) to specify or change the post office address to which the Secretary of State can mail a copy of any notice required by law; (3) to make, revoke, or change the designation of a registered agent or to specify or change the address of its registered agent<trace>; and (4 ) to specify, change or delete the email address to which the secretary of state shall email a notice of the fact that process against the corporation has been electronically served upon him or her</trace>. <st>N-PCL &sect;802(c).</st>
</para.text>
</para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text><rc>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;154</rc></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
<form.name.block>Paragraph Sixth.</form.name.block>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|38|31:37">
<para.text>
The Certificate of Amendment must include a designation of the New York Secretary of State as agent of the corporation upon whom process against the corporation may be served, as well as the post office address within or without New York State to which the Secretary of State shall mail a copy of any process against the corporation that is served upon him or her. <st>N-PCL &sect;803(a)(6).</st>
</para.text>
</para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text><rc>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;154</rc></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
<form.name.block>Paragraph Seventh.</form.name.block>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|38|31:37">
<para.text>
The Certificate of Amendment must include the manner in which the amendment of the certificate of incorporation was authorized. <st>N-PCL &sect;803(a)(5).</st>
</para.text>
</para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text><rc>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;154</rc></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
</form>
</section.body>
</section>

I, the undersigned, being the <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__title of officer__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr> of <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__name of corporation__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr> (hereinafter called the “Corporation”), hereby certify that:
</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>

</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>3.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|39|31:38">

</form.para>
<form.para>

RESOLVED, that the board of directors request <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__name of company__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr> to proceed with the filing of Form 1023 in order to obtain such recognition by the Internal Revenue Service and to be paid the respective fees that might be required to pay with the application.

<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block>
<label>&sect;</label>
<designator>31:42</designator>
<name>Minutes of first meeting of board of directors<sep/> Payment of organizational expenses</name>
</outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>

<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Ic70620b0181b11e68c12afa7f3a24041">
<form.para>
<form.text>Minutes of the first meeting of the board of directors named in the certificate of incorporation of <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of corporation__rsqb__</inline.instr>, a New York not-for-profit corporation, which meeting was held at <inline.instr>__lsqb__address of corporation__rsqb__</inline.instr>, <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of city__rsqb__</inline.instr>, <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of county__rsqb__</inline.instr>, State of New York, on <inline.instr>__lsqb__date of first meeting__rsqb__</inline.instr>, at <inline.instr>__lsqb__time of first meeting__rsqb__</inline.instr>.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>1</designator>
<name>Attendance.</name>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|43|31:42">
<form.text>Present at the meeting and constituting a quorum of the full board were: <inline.instr>__lsqb__names of directors in attendance__rsqb__</inline.instr>.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|43|31:42">
<form.text>Absent were: <inline.instr>__lsqb__names of absent directors__rsqb__</inline.instr>.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>2</designator>
<name>Temporary Chairperson and Secretary.</name>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|43|31:42">
<form.text>On motion duly approved, <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of temporary chairperson__rsqb__</inline.instr> was elected temporary chairperson and <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of temporary secretary__rsqb__</inline.instr> was elected temporary secretary of the meeting.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>3</designator>
<name>Call and Notice of Meeting.</name>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|43|31:42">
<form.text><inline.instr>__lsqb__Specification of manner of notice of meeting__rsqb__</inline.instr>. On motion duly approved, a copy of the call and notice was made a part of the minutes of this meeting.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>4</designator>
<name>Filing of Certificate of Incorporation.</name>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|43|31:42">
<form.text>The temporary chairperson reported that the original certificate of incorporation was filed with the Secretary of State of the State of New York on <inline.instr>__lsqb__date of filing original certificate of incorporation__rsqb__</inline.instr>. A certified copy of the certificate of incorporation, showing the above filing, was delivered to the temporary secretary with directions to insert it in the minute book of the corporation.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>5</designator>
<name>Adoption of Bylaws.</name>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|43|31:42">
<form.text>A draft of bylaws prepared by the attorney for the corporation was presented by the acting secretary, who read the full text to the meeting. After discussion, on motion duly approved, the following resolution was adopted:</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>6</designator>
<name>Election of Officers.</name>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|43|31:42">
<form.text>The chairperson announced that the bylaws provided for the election of a president, vice-president, secretary, and treasurer and that nominations were in order for the election of such officers. The following slate of officers was then nominated:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|43|31:42">
<form.text><inline.instr>__lsqb__Name of president__rsqb__</inline.instr>, President; <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of vice-president__rsqb__</inline.instr>, Vice-President; <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of secretary__rsqb__</inline.instr>, Secretary; <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of treasurer__rsqb__</inline.instr>, Treasurer. There being no further nominations, by motion duly approved, the slate of nominees was elected to hold office <inline.instr>__lsqb__OPTIONAL: for the terms provided in the bylaws__rsqb__</inline.instr>.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|43|31:42">
<form.text>Each elected officer was present at the meeting and assumed the duties of office. The President replaced the temporary chairperson as presiding officer of the meeting. The Secretary replaced the temporary secretary of the meeting.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>7</designator>
<name>Bond for Treasurer.</name>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|43|31:42">
<form.text>On motion made, seconded, and unanimously carried, it was resolved that the Treasurer be required to post a corporate surety bond in the amount of $<inline.instr>__lsqb__dollar amount of corporate surety bond__rsqb__</inline.instr> before assuming the duties of that office and that the President be authorized to approve the bond as to its sufficiency and form.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>8</designator>
<name>Adoption of Seal.</name>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|43|31:42">
<form.text>On motion duly approved, it was resolved that the corporation adopt as its seal the words, figures, and design impressed on these minutes consisting of the words <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of corporation__rsqb__</inline.instr>, and the words and figures “Incorporated on <inline.instr>__lsqb__date of incorporation__rsqb__</inline.instr>, State of New York.” <inline.instr>__lsqb__Impression of seal__rsqb__</inline.instr>.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>9</designator>
<name>Depository for and Withdrawal of Funds.</name>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|43|31:42">
<form.text>To provide a depository for the funds of the corporation and to authorize those who may withdraw such funds on behalf of the corporation, on motion duly approved, the following resolution was adopted:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|43|31:42">
<form.text>Resolved, that <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of financial institution__rsqb__</inline.instr>, a corporation (the “depository”), is selected as a depository for the funds of this corporation and that accounts shall be governed by the rules, regulations, bylaws, and practices, present and future, of the depository, including interest and service charges;</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|43|31:42">
<form.text>Further resolved, that the following officers of this corporation, who have been regularly elected or appointed:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|43|31:42">
<form.text>To provide a depository for the funds of the corporation and to authorize those who may withdraw such funds on behalf of the corporation, on motion duly approved, the following resolution was adopted:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|43|31:42">
<form.text>Resolved, that <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of financial institution__rsqb__</inline.instr>, a corporation (the “depository”), is selected as a depository for the funds of this corporation and that accounts shall be governed by the rules, regulations, bylaws, and practices, present and future, of the depository, including interest and service charges;</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|43|31:42">
<form.text>Further resolved, that the following officers of this corporation, who have been regularly elected or appointed:</form.text>
</form.para>
<tbl>
<table>

<row><entry align="center" resize="same" style="block"><inline.instr>__lsqb__Name 2__rsqb__</inline.instr></entry><entry align="center" resize="same" style="block"><inline.instr>__lsqb__title 2__rsqb__</inline.instr></entry></row>
