<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block>
<label>&sect;</label>
<designator>31:54</designator>
<name>Bylaws<sep/> Provision<sep/> Board of directors</name>
</outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>CLS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Ic709a320181b11e68c12afa7f3a24041">
<form.name.block>
<name>BOARD OF DIRECTORS</name>
</form.name.block>
<form.unit>
<form.para>
<form.text>SECTION 1 General Powers</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|55|31:54">
<form.text>The affairs of the corporation shall be managed by its board of directors.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>SECTION 2 Number, Tenure, and Qualifications</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|55|31:54">
<form.text>The number of directors shall be three. Each director shall hold office until the next annual meeting of members and until his or her successors shall have been elected and qualified. Directors need not be residents of New York or members of the corporation. The number of directors may be decreased to not fewer than three or increased to any number from time to time by amendment of this section, unless the articles of incorporation provide that a change in the number of directors shall be made only by amendment of the articles of incorporation.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>SECTION 3 Regular Meetings</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|55|31:54">
<form.text>A regular annual meeting of the board of directors shall be held without other notice than these bylaws, immediately after, and at the same place as, the annual meeting of members. The board of directors may provide by resolution the time and place for the holding of additional regular meetings of the board without other notice than such resolution.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>SECTION 4 Special Meetings</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|55|31:54">
<form.text>Special meetings of the board of directors may be called by or at the request of the president or any two directors. The person or persons authorized to call special meetings of the board may fix any place as the place for holding any special meeting of the board called by them.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>SECTION 5 Notice</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|55|31:54">
<form.text>Notice of any special meeting of the board of directors shall be given at least <inline.instr>__lsqb__number of days__rsqb__</inline.instr> days previously thereto by written notice to each director at his or her address as shown by the records of the corporation. If mailed, such notice is given when deposited in the United States mail in a sealed envelope so addressed, with postage thereon prepaid. If sent by facsimile telecommunication or mailed electronically, such notice is given when directed to the director's fax number or electronic mail address. Notice of any special meeting of the board of directors may be waived in writing signed by the person or persons entitled to the notice either before or after the time of the meeting. The attendance of a director at any meeting shall constitute a waiver of notice of such meeting, except where a director attends a meeting for the express purpose of objecting to the transaction of any business because the meeting is not lawfully called or convened. Neither the business to be transacted at, nor the purpose of, any regular or special meeting of the board need be specified in the notice or waiver of notice of such meeting, unless specifically required by law or by these bylaws.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>SECTION 6 Informal Action by Directors</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|55|31:54">
<form.text>Any action required to be taken at a meeting of the directors of the corporation, or any other action which may be taken at a meeting of directors, may be taken without a meeting if a consent in writing or electronic, setting forth the action so taken, shall be signed by all of the directors entitled to vote with respect to the subject matter thereof.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>SECTION 7 Quorum</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|55|31:54">
<form.text>A majority of the board of directors shall constitute a quorum for the transaction of business at any meeting of the board, provided that if less than a majority of the directors are present at said meeting, a majority of the directors present may adjourn the meeting to another time without further notice.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>SECTION 8 Manner of Acting</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|55|31:54">
<form.text>The act of a majority of the directors present at a meeting at which a quorum is present shall be the act of the board of directors, unless the act of a greater number is required by statute, these bylaws, or the articles of incorporation.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>SECTION 9 Vacancies</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|55|31:54">
<form.text>Any vacancy occurring in the board of directors or any directorship to be filled by reason of an increase in the number of directors shall be filled by the members unless the articles of incorporation, a statute, or these bylaws provide that a vacancy or a directorship so created shall be filled in some other manner, in which case such provision shall control. A director elected to fill a vacancy shall be elected for the unexpired term of his or her predecessor in office.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>SECTION 10 Compensation</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|55|31:54">
<form.text>Directors shall not receive any stated salaries for their services, but by resolution of the board of directors a fixed sum and expenses of attendance, if any, may be allowed for each regular or special meeting of the board, provided that nothing herein contained shall be construed to preclude any director from serving the corporation in any other capacity and receiving reasonable compensation therefor.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.unit>
<note.block>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><tk>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3384</tk></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
</form>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block>
<label>&sect;</label>
<designator>31:55</designator>
<name>Bylaws<sep/> Provision<sep/> Board of directors<sep/> Newly created directorships and vacancies</name>
</outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>CLS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Ic709a321181b11e68c12afa7f3a24041">
<form.para>
<form.text>Newly created Directorships resulting from an increase in the number of Directors and vacancies occurring in the Board of Directors for any reason shall be filled by vote of a majority of Directors then in office, regardless of their number. Directors elected to fill newly created Directorships shall hold office in accordance with their classification (if Directors are classified) and until their successors have been elected and qualified. Directors elected to fill vacancies shall serve until the next annual meeting at which the election of Directors is in the regular order of business and until their successors are elected and have qualified.</form.text>
</form.para>
<note.block>
<research.reference.block>

<section date.trace="1">
<section.front><outline.name.block>
<label>&sect;</label>
<designator>31:55.50</designator>
<name>Bylaws<sep/> Provision <sep/>Board of directors<sep/> Meetings</name>
</outline.name.block>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form.para date.updated="1" date.trace="1">
<form.text>Regular meetings of the board may be held on such dates and at such times and places as set by the secretary, subject to approval of the board. The annual meeting of the board must be held in <inline.instr>[specification of time of year]</inline.instr> of each year. A special meeting of the board may be called, and the date, time and place of the meeting will be set, by the board chair, the president, or any <inline.instr>[number of directors]</inline.instr> directors.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para date.updated="1" date.trace="1">
<form.text>The secretary must give to each director not less than <inline.instr>[number of days]</inline.instr> days' written notice of the time and place of each annual and regular meeting of the board, and must give <inline.instr>[number of days]</inline.instr> days' written notice of special meetings.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para date.updated="1" date.trace="1">
<form.text>At the annual meeting of the board, the president and the treasurer must present the annual financial report required by <st>Section 519 of the New York Not-for-Profit Corporation Law</st> or any successor statute. The report must be filed with the minutes of the annual meeting.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para date.updated="1" date.trace="1">
<form.text>A majority of the entire board will constitute a quorum for the transaction of business at meetings of the board. Except as required by law or these bylaws, all matters will be decided by a majority vote of the directors present at a meeting at which a quorum is present. In the absence of a quorum at the time and place set for a meeting of the board, the directors present may adjourn the meeting from time to time until a quorum is present.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para date.updated="1" date.trace="1">
<form.text>Any one or more of the directors may participate in a meeting of the board by means of conference telephone, videoconference, or other communications equipment as long as all persons participating in the meeting can hear each other at the same time. Participation by such means will be deemed presence in person at the meeting.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para date.updated="1" date.trace="1">
<form.text>Any action required or permitted to be taken by the board may be taken without a meeting, if all the directors consent to the adoption of a resolution authorizing the action. Consent may be written or electronic. If written, the consent must be executed by the director by signing such consent or causing his or her signature to be affixed to such consent by any reasonable means, including but not limited to facsimile signature. If electronic, the transmission of the consent must be sent by electronic mail and set forth or be submitted with information from which it can reasonably be determined that the transmission was authorized by the director. The resolution and the consents thereto shall be filed with the minutes of the board.</form.text>
</form.para>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text> <tk>West's Key Number Digest, Corporations and Business Organizations &key;3384</tk></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>

</section.body>

<section.body>
<form uuid="Ic709f140181b11e68c12afa7f3a24041">
<form.name.block>
<name>Voting and Quorum</name>
</form.name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|58|31:57">
<form.text>
Each director of the board of directors shall have one vote. Unless otherwise specified herein, the vote of the majority of the directors of the board of directors present at a meeting in which a quorum is present shall be the act of the board of directors. A majority of the number of directors of the board of directors then in office shall constitute a quorum for the transaction of business at any meeting of the board of directors, but if less than a quorum is present at a meeting, a majority of the directors of the board of directors present at such meeting may adjourn the meeting from time to time, without notice other than announcement at the meeting, until a quorum shall be present.
</form.text>
</form.para>
<field>fac.lo="n"</field>Proxies
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|58|31:57">
<form.text>
A director of the board of directors may vote at any meeting by a written or electronic proxy executed by such director and delivered to another director. A proxy shall be revocable unless it is stated to be irrevocable.
</form.text>
</form.para>

<name>Books, Records, and Accounting</name>
</form.name.block>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(a)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|59|31:58">
<form.text>Bank Accounts. If the <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of charitable corporation__rsqb__</inline.instr> deems appropriate, funds of <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of charitable corporation__rsqb__</inline.instr> may be deposited in a bank account or accounts maintained in <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of charitable corporation__rsqb__</inline.instr>'s name. Such funds may from time to time be loaned to an affiliate of <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of charitable corporation__rsqb__</inline.instr> in any manner <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of charitable corporation__rsqb__</inline.instr> deems appropriate. The directors shall determine the institution or institutions at which the accounts will be opened and maintained, the types of accounts, and the persons who will have authority with respect to the accounts and the funds therein.</form.text>

</form.para>
</form.item>

The annual accounting period of <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of charitable corporation__rsqb__</inline.instr> shall be the <inline.instr>__lsqb__calendar/fiscal__rsqb__</inline.instr> year as follows: <inline.instr>__lsqb__[specification of calendar year__rsqb__</inline.instr>/<inline.instr>__lsqb__specification of fiscal year end__rsqb__</inline.instr>]. Unless otherwise determined by the directors, <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of charitable corporation__rsqb__</inline.instr>'s method of accounting shall be <inline.instr>__lsqb__specification of accounting method__rsqb__</inline.instr>.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(d)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|59|31:58">

<form uuid="Ic70a3f60181b11e68c12afa7f3a24041">
<form.para>
<form.text>These Bylaws may be amended, altered, or repealed at any meeting of the Board by vote of two-thirds of all Directors present and voting, or they may be amended, altered, or repealed by the written consent of all the Directors without a meeting. All proposed amendments must be presented at least <inline.instr>__lsqb__specification of time period__rsqb__</inline.instr> prior to the vote, with notice of such proposed amendments to all Directors.</form.text>

<section.front>
<outline.name.block>
<label>&sect;</label>
<designator>31:60</designator>
<name>Narrative description of activities</name>
</outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>CLS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Ic70a6670181b11e68c12afa7f3a24041">
<form.para>
<form.text>170(c)(2) of the Internal Revenue Code, primarily distributions of cash or other assets to qualified organizations for charitable and education purposes to be determined by the Board of Directors of the Foundation. Distributions will be made exclusively for charitable, scientific, literary, educational or other exempt purposes specified in Section 170(c)(2)(B). Grants will not be made to charities organized outside of the United States.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|62|31:60">
<form.text>
Activities will be conducted by Foundation Directors, officers and staff from the Foundation's offices in <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__name of city__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr> and will consist of evaluating grantee organizations, monitoring the Foundation's investments, administering grants and Foundation fundraising, and conducting all relevant Foundation business.
</form.text>
</form.para>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|62|31:60">
<para.text>
For purposes of <st>IRS Form 1023</st>, this description of the activities of a charitable foundation can be used.
</para.text>
</para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><tk>West's Key Number Digest, Internal Revenue &key;4063</tk></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
</form>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block>
<label>&sect;</label>
<designator>31:61</designator>
<name>Narrative description of activities<sep/> Scholarship fund</name>
</outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>CLS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Ic70a8d80181b11e68c12afa7f3a24041">
<form.para>
<form.text>The purpose of this scholarship fund is to continue the legacy of <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of person for which foundation is named__rsqb__</inline.instr>'s concern for education to be a catalyst for positive change in the lives of others. To this end, the <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of foundation__rsqb__</inline.instr> Scholarship is designed to provide recognition for a deserving candidate and financial assistance for their initial year in college.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|63|31:61">
<form.text>
The educational grants provided by the foundation will be a one-time, nonrenewable, unrestricted stipend to be used by the recipient for costs associated with attending college (tuition, room, board, textbooks, etc).
</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|63|31:61">
<form.text>
The purpose of the stipend is to provide positive recognition and assistance to a student entering college. The hope is that the stipend will be a positive catalyst for the student's development by covering unanticipated expenses or fees and allowing the student to concentrate on beginning their collegiate experience successfully. The award will be a $<inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__dollar amount of stipend__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr> nonrenewable stipend for the student's first year only. One grant will be awarded annually.
</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|63|31:61">
<form.text>
In order to be eligible for the stipend, applicants must:
</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(a)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|63|31:61">
<form.text>provide name, address, birth date;</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(b)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|63|31:61">
<form.text>provide proof of acceptance into an accredited college or university;</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(c)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|63|31:61">
<form.text>commence full-time student status in the academic year following application; and</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(d)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|63|31:61">
<form.text><inline.instr>__lsqb__list of other requirements for candidates eligible for scholarship fund__rsqb__</inline.instr>.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|63|31:61">
<form.text>Applicants will need to demonstrate via the application questions and by writing a short essay the qualities of leadership through service, creativity, and high potential for positive future impact for their community.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(a)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|63|31:61">
<form.text>List your major activities and accomplishments from the last three years (including your freshman year) at school and in your community. Include any awards or special recognition.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(b)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|63|31:61">
<form.text>Select and briefly describe your three or four most significant accomplishments. (Please limit your comments to one or two sentences for each item).</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(c)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|63|31:61">
<form.text>Essay question: <inline.instr>__lsqb__statement of question for scholarship candidates__rsqb__</inline.instr>.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|63|31:61">
<form.text>An award recipient will be selected from all applicants. The award winner will be, in the opinion of the selection committee, the applicant most demonstrative of being a catalyst for positive change in the lives of others.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|63|31:61">
<para.text>
For purposes of <st>IRS Form 1023</st>, this description of the activities of a charitable foundation for an educational scholarship can be used.
</para.text>
</para>
</note.group>

<form.name.block>
<name>CERTIFICATE OF MERGER OF <inline.instr>__lsqb__NAME OF CONSTITUENT CORPORATION 1__rsqb__</inline.instr> INTO <inline.instr>__lsqb__NAME OF CONSTITUENT CORPORATION 2__rsqb__</inline.instr></name>
</form.name.block>
<field>fac.lo="n"</field>Under Section 904 of the Not-For-Profit Corporation Law of the State of New York
<form.line align="l">
</form.line>
<signature.block ref="manual">
<signature.group position="r">
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
</signature.group>
</signature.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|64|31:62">
<form.text>
The undersigned, being the <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__title of officer 1__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr> and <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__title of officer 2__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr>, respectively, of each of <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__name of constituent corporation 1__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr> and <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__name of constituent corporation 2__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr> hereby certify that:
</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.para>
<form.text>1.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|64|31:62">
<form.text>(a) The names of the constituent corporations are <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of constituent corporation 1__rsqb__</inline.instr> and <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of constituent corporation 2__rsqb__</inline.instr>.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.item>

<designator>(b)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|64|31:62">

</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(c)</designator>
</name.block>

</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>(d)</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|64|31:62">
<form.text>The Certificate of Incorporation of <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of constituent corporation 2__rsqb__</inline.instr> was filed by the Department of State of the State of New York on the <inline.instr>__lsqb__ordinal number of day__rsqb__</inline.instr> day of <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of month__rsqb__</inline.instr> <inline.instr>__lsqb__identification of year__rsqb__</inline.instr>.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.para>
<form.text>2.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|64|31:62">
<form.text>The following persons constitute all of the members of each constituent corporation:</form.text>
</form.para>

<form.text>p.fl="none"><inline.instr>__lsqb__names of members__rsqb__</inline.instr> each of whom, if present in person or by proxy, is entitled to one vote in respect of any matter on which such members are entitled to vote at all meetings of the members of each such corporation.</form.text>

<form.para>

<form.para>

</form.para>
<form.para>
<form.text>5.</form.text>

<form uuid="Ic70b9ef0181b11e68c12afa7f3a24041">
<form.name.block>
<name>ATTACHMENT TO EXEMPTION APPLICATION OF <inline.instr>__lsqb__NAME OF ORGANIZATION__rsqb__</inline.instr>: CERTIFICATION AS TO ACCURACY OF COPIES</name>
</form.name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|68|31:66">
<form.text>
The undersigned, <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__name of officer__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr>, declares that <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__he/she__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr> is the <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__title of officer__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr> of <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__name of organization__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr>, a New York not-for-profit <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__specification of entity__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr> having an office at <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__address of organization__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr>, <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__name of city__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr>, <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__name of county__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr>, State of New York, and, in that capacity, is authorized to sign for such applicant.
</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|68|31:66">
<form.text>
The undersigned further declares and certifies that the copies of <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__specification of documents__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr> to which this certification is attached, are complete and accurate copies of the originals of such documents.
</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|68|31:66">
<form.text>
I certify under penalty of perjury that the foregoing is true and correct.
</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|68|31:66">
<form.text>
Executed at <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__place of execution__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr>, New York, on <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__date of execution__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr>.
</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.line align="l">
</form.line>
<signature.block ref="manual">
<signature.group position="r">
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
<form.line align="l" lineover="y">
<inline.instr>&lsqb;Name of officer&rsqb;</inline.instr>
</form.line>
<form.line align="l">
<inline.instr>&lsqb;Title of officer&rsqb;</inline.instr>
</form.line>
</signature.group>
</signature.block>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|68|31:66">
<para.text>
If the application does not contain the required information, it may be returned with a letter of explanation without being considered on its merits. If the completed application is resubmitted within the time period indicated in the letter from the IRS, it will be considered received on the original submission date. In that case, if the original submission was timely, the application will be considered timely filed.
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|68|31:66">
<para.text>
Where the application requires a “conformed copy,” it must agree with the original document and all amendments thereto. If the copies are not signed, they must be accompanied by a written declaration signed by an officer authorized to sign for the organization, certifying that they are complete and accurate copies of the original documents. See <st>Rev. Proc. 68-14, 1968-1 C.B. 768</st> and <st>I.R.S. Pub. 557</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><tk>West's Key Number Digest, Internal Revenue &key;4045 to 4079</tk></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
</form>

</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Ic70bc600181b11e68c12afa7f3a24041">
<form.name.block>
<name>ATTACHMENT TO EXEMPTION APPLICATION OF <inline.instr>__lsqb__NAME OF ORGANIZATION__rsqb__</inline.instr>: INFORMATION TO BE WITHHELD FROM PUBLIC INSPECTION</name>
</form.name.block>
<caption.block ref="manual" date.updated="0">
<form.line align = "c">To: District Director</form.line>
</caption.block>
<form.line align="l">
Internal Revenue Service
</form.line>
<signature.block ref="manual">
<signature.group position="r">
<form.line align="l">
<inline.instr>&lsqb;Address of office&rsqb;</inline.instr>
</form.line>
</signature.group>
</signature.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|69|31:67">
<form.text>
The undersigned, <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__name of requester__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr>, on behalf of <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__name of organization__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr>, a New York not-for-profit <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__specification of entity__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr> having an office at <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__address of organization__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr>, <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__name of city__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr>, <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__name of county__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr>, State of New York, requests that the following information, disclosed on lines <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__designation of line numbers__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr> in its Application for Recognition of Exemption, be withheld from public inspection: <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__description of information to be withheld__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr>.
</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|69|31:67">
<form.text>
This request is made for the following reasons: <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__list of reasons for making request__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr>.
</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.line align="l">
</form.line>
<signature.block ref="manual">
<signature.group position="r">
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
<form.line align="l">
Dated:
<inline.instr>&lsqb;date of request&rsqb;</inline.instr>
</form.line>
</signature.group>
<signature.group position="r">
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
<form.line align="l" lineover="y">
<inline.instr>&lsqb;Name of requester&rsqb;</inline.instr>
</form.line>
</signature.group>
</signature.block>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|69|31:67">
<para.text>
Any information submitted in the application or in support of it that relates to any trade secret, patent, process, style of work, or apparatus, upon request, may be withheld from public inspection if the Commissioner determines that the disclosure of such information would adversely affect the organization. The request must:
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|69|31:67">
<para.text>
1. Identify the material to be withheld (the document, page, paragraph, and line) by clearly marking it, “Not Subject to Public Inspection.”
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|69|31:67">
<para.text>
2. Include the reasons for your organization's position that the information is of the type that may be withheld from public inspection.
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|69|31:67">
<para.text>
3. Be filed with the office where your organization files the documents in which the material to be withheld is contained.
</para.text>
</para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><tk>West's Key Number Digest, Internal Revenue &key;4045 to 4079</tk></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Disclosure requirements, <rc>Federal Tax Guide to Legal Forms &sect;10:58</rc></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>

<section.body>
<form uuid="Ic70bed10181b11e68c12afa7f3a24041">
<caption.block ref="manual" date.updated="0">
<form.line align = "c">To: District Director</form.line>
</caption.block>
<form.line align="l">
Internal Revenue Service
</form.line>
<signature.block ref="manual">
<signature.group position="r">
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
<form.line align="l">
<inline.instr>&lsqb;Address of office&rsqb;</inline.instr>
</form.line>
<form.line align="l">
Re:
<inline.instr>&lsqb;Name of organization&rsqb;</inline.instr>
</form.line>
<form.line align="l">
<inline.instr>&lsqb;Sir/Madam&rsqb;</inline.instr>
</form.line>
</signature.group>
</signature.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|70|31:68">
<form.text>
Request is hereby made, pursuant to <st>Title 26 of the Code of Federal Regulations, Section 1.508-1(a)(2)(i)</st>, for an extension of time during which to file an Application for Recognition of Exemption (Form 1023) with respect to the above <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__name of organization__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr>, organized on <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__date of organization__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr>, under the laws of the State of New York.
</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|70|31:68">
<form.text>
The reason for this request is <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__statement of reasons for making request__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr>.
</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.line align="l">
</form.line>
<signature.block ref="manual">
<signature.group position="r">
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
<form.line align="l">
Dated:
<inline.instr>&lsqb;date of request&rsqb;</inline.instr>
</form.line>
</signature.group>
<signature.group position="r">
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
<form.line align="l" lineover="y">
<inline.instr>&lsqb;Name of requester&rsqb;</inline.instr>
</form.line>
</signature.group>
</signature.block>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="taxnotes">
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|70|31:68">
<para.text>
An organization seeking tax exemption under <st>26 U.S.C.A. &sect;501(c)(3)&mdash;charitable, religious, educational, etc. organizations&mdash;</st> must notify the Internal Revenue Service that it considers itself exempt within 15 months of organization. <st>26 C.F.R. &sect;1.508-1(a)(2)</st>. This requirement does not apply to churches, church organizations, or organizations (other than private foundations) with normal receipts of less than $5,000 a year. <st>26 U.S.C.A. &sect;508(c)</st>. The above form is a request that this 15-month period be extended and is allowed under the regulation cited. (See also <cc>National Paralegal Inst. Coalition v. C.I.R., T.C. Memo. 2005-293, T.C.M. (RIA) P 2005-293 (2005)</cc>, where the Service reviews procedural aspects of filing Form 1023).
</para.text>
</para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><tk>West's Key Number Digest, Internal Revenue &key;4045 to 4079</tk></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text>Application by a charitable organization for determination of exempt status, <rc>RIA Federal Tax Coordinator 2d &dblpara;D-4000 et seq</rc>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text>Application for exempt status, <rc>Federal Tax Guide to Legal Forms &sect;10:57</rc></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>

<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block>
<label>&sect;</label>
<designator>31:69</designator>
<name>Notice of availability of private foundation's annual return</name>
</outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TXA</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TFD</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TF2</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>EBL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Ic70c1420181b11e68c12afa7f3a24041">
<form.para>
<form.text>The annual return for <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of foundation__rsqb__</inline.instr> for the <inline.instr>__lsqb__fiscal/calendar__rsqb__</inline.instr> year ending <inline.instr>__lsqb__end date of year__rsqb__</inline.instr> is available for public inspection during regular business hours by any interested individual at the Foundation's principal office located at <inline.instr>__lsqb__office address of foundation__rsqb__</inline.instr>, <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of city__rsqb__</inline.instr>, <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of county__rsqb__</inline.instr>, <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of state__rsqb__</inline.instr>, <inline.instr>__lsqb__telephone number of foundation__rsqb__</inline.instr>, beginning on the date of this publication and continuing for 180 days thereafter.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|71|31:69">
<form.text>
Also available for inspection are the Foundation's application for determination of tax exemption and determination for the same by the Internal Revenue Service.
</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|71|31:69">
<form.text>
To request copies of the annual return and/or the exemption application, please direct your request to <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__name of officer 1__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr>, <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__address of officer 1__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr>, <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__name of city__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr>, <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__name of county__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr>, <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__name of state__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr>. Inspection may also be made in person at the above address. To schedule an inspection, please call <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__name of officer 2__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr> at <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__telephone number of officer 2__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr>.
</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|71|31:69">
<form.text>
The principal manager of the Foundation is <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__name of principal manager__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr>.
</form.text>
</form.para>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="taxnotes">
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|71|31:69">
<para.text>
In New York, <st>Section 8-1.8 of the N.Y. Estates, Powers &amp; Trusts Law</st> and <st>Section 406 of the N.Y. Not-for-Profit Corporation Law</st> require that private foundations publish notice of the availability of returns for inspection and that this notice be published no later than the last day for filing the return in question. The clerk of the county in which the private foundation's principal office is located designates in which newspaper in that county the publication must be made. The published notice is required to state that the foundation's annual return is available at its principal office for inspection during regular business hours by any citizen who requests it within 180 days after the date of publication. The notice must also state the address and telephone number of the foundation's principal office and the name of its principal manager.
</para.text>
</para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><tk>West's Key Number Digest, Charities &key;41.5</tk></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><tk>West's Key Number Digest, Charities &key;42</tk></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><tk>West's Key Number Digest, Internal Revenue &key;4063</tk></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><tk>West's Key Number Digest, Internal Revenue &key;4482</tk></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text><rc>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Business Relationships &sect;378</rc></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text><rc>N.Y. Jur. 2d, Charities &sect;87</rc></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry><ref.text><rc>Am. Jur. 2d, Corporations &sect;278</rc></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
</form>
</section.body>

<label>&sect;</label>
<designator>31:71.50</designator>
<name>Resolution approving t ax- e xempt d ocument filing</name>
</outline.name.block>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form.para date.updated="1" date.trace="1"><form.text>RESOLVED, to authorize the Officers to prepare and file with the Internal Revenue Service an application for exemption from taxation under <st>Section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code</st>; and to prepare and file with the New York Department of Taxation appropriate applications for exemption from state and local taxation.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para date.updated="1" date.trace="1"><form.text>RESOLVED, to authorize the initial filing of the <inline.instr>[title of form]</inline.instr> ( <inline.instr>[name of form]</inline.instr> ) and all subsequent filings to maintain the Corporation's registration status with the Attorney General of New York.</form.text></form.para>
<form.para date.updated="1" date.trace="1"><form.text>RESOLVED, to authorize the Officers to execute and deliver any forms, documents or certificates as may be necessary or desirable to carry out the intent of the foregoing resolutions and to file such periodic reports and amendments as are necessary to maintain the Corporation's ability to solicit contributions as a charitable organization.</form.text></form.para>
<research.reference.block>

<section.body>
<form uuid="Ic70c8950181b11e68c12afa7f3a24041">
<image.block ct.id="UNKNOWN_CT_ID">
<image ident="I02FDFG"/>
<image ident="I02FENE"/>
<image ident="I02FNCF"/>
<image ident="I02GS6X"/>
</image.block>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|74|31:72">
<form.text>
The above form, revised 12/13, is available from the New York State Department of Taxation and Finance, <url>http://www.tax.ny.gov</url>, and is reprinted here for illustrative purposes.
</form.text>
</form.para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><tk>West's Key Number Digest, Internal Revenue &key;4045 to 4079</tk></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
</form>
</section.body>
</section>

</outline.name.block>
<online.view>

<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>EFM</online.view.item>

<section date.trace="1">
<section.front><outline.name.block>
<label>&sect;</label>
<designator>31:74</designator>
<name>Application for real property tax exemption for nonprofit organizations<sep/> Official form</name>
</outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TXA</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TSX</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TS8</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>EFM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>EBL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Ic70cd770181b11e68c12afa7f3a24041">
<image.block ct.id="UNKNOWN_CT_ID">
<image ident="I04YDMQ"/>
<image ident="I05014I"/>
<image ident="I02XKLE"/>
<image ident="I030437"/>
</image.block>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|76|31:74">
<form.text>
The above form, revised 9/08, is available from the New York State Department of Taxation and Finance, <url>http://www.tax.ny.gov</url>, and is reprinted here for illustrative purposes.
</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|76|31:74">
<form.text>
Real property that is owned by a not-for-profit corporation organized for religious or educational purposes and used exclusively for carrying out such purposes is entitled to be exempt from real estate taxes. <cc>Sisters of the Presentation of the Blessed Virgin Mary v. Van Wagenen, 223 A.D.3d 987, 202 N.Y.S.3d 814, 425 Ed. Law Rep. 950 (3d Dep't 2024), appeal dismissed, 41 N.Y.3d 990, 211 N.Y.S.3d 262, 234 N.E.3d 1054 (2024).</cc>
</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|76|31:74">
<form.text>
A building was not property-tax exempt under the <st>statutory provision allowing for a property-tax exemption for property that was owned by certain not-for-profit entities and that was used for certain not-for-profit purposes</st>; the building owner was a not-for-profit healthcare fund that did not reside on the premises or otherwise itself use the building in whole or in part for its exempt fundraising purpose, and the owner's tenant was a for-profit corporation that had sole occupancy and used the building during the lease term exclusively to perform its for-charge dialysis services. <cc>Brookdale Physicians' Dialysis Associates, Inc. v. Department of Finance of City of New York, 41 N.Y.3d 608, 215 N.Y.S.3d 51, 239 N.E.3d 157 (2024)</cc>.
</form.text>
</form.para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><tk>West's Key Number Digest, Internal Revenue &key;4045 to 4079</tk></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
</form>
</section.body>
</section>
<section date.trace="1">
<section.front><outline.name.block>
<label>&sect;</label>
<designator>31:75</designator>
<name>Renewal application for real property tax exemption for nonprofit organizations<sep/> Official form</name>
</outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TXA</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TSX</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TS8</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>EFM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>EBL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Ic70cfe80181b11e68c12afa7f3a24041">
<image.block ct.id="UNKNOWN_CT_ID">
<image ident="I01EKO0"/>
<image ident="I01DFYZ"/>
</image.block>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|77|31:75">
<form.text>
The above form, revised 2/22, is available from the New York State Department of Taxation and Finance, <url>http://www.tax.ny.gov</url>, and is reprinted here for illustrative purposes.
</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|77|31:75">
<form.text>
A not-for-profit corporation that owned property that had previously qualified as exempt from real property taxes as being used for religious and educational purposes was entitled to continued exemption only for the portion of the property that was still being used for those purposes as a playground for students and areas that were incidental to such use; the remaining portion of the property containing a vacant and unused school and mansion that were not safe to use and had no running water, and thus no longer served to further the exempted purpose. <cc>Sisters of the Presentation of the Blessed Virgin Mary v. Van Wagenen, 223 A.D.3d 987, 202 N.Y.S.3d 814, 425 Ed. Law Rep. 950 (3d Dep't 2024), appeal dismissed, 41 N.Y.3d 990, 211 N.Y.S.3d 262, 234 N.E.3d 1054 (2024)</cc>.
</form.text>
</form.para>
</note.group>

<reference.entry><ref.text><tk>West's Key Number Digest, Internal Revenue &key;4045 to 4079</tk></ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>

<form uuid="Ic70d2590181b11e68c12afa7f3a24041">

</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block>
<label>&sect;</label>
<designator>31:77</designator>
<name>Conflict of interest policy for charitable organization</name>
</outline.name.block>
<online.view>
<online.view.item>FMS</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>COL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>NFP</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FCV</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>FTR</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>EBL</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>TEM</online.view.item>
<online.view.item>MTD</online.view.item>
</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Ic70d73b0181b11e68c12afa7f3a24041">
<form.unit>
<form.para>
<form.text>CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>I</designator>
<name>PURPOSE</name>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|79|31:77">
<form.text>The purpose of this conflict of interest policy is to protect the interest of <inline.instr>__lsqb__name of charitable organization__rsqb__</inline.instr> (“Organization”) when it is contemplating entering into a transaction or arrangement that might benefit the private interest of an officer or director of the Organization or might result in a possible excess benefit transaction. This policy is intended to supplement, but not replace, any applicable state and federal laws governing conflict of interest applicable to nonprofit and charitable organizations such as the Organization.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|79|31:77">
<form.text>Any director, principal officer, or member of a committee with governing board delegated powers, who has a direct or indirect financial interest, as defined below, is an interested person.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|79|31:77">
<form.text>A person has a financial interest if the person has, directly or indirectly, through business, investment, or family:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>a</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|79|31:77">
<form.text>An ownership or investment interest in any entity with which the Organization has a transaction or arrangement;</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>b</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|79|31:77">
<form.text>A compensation arrangement with the Organization or with any entity or individual with which the Organization has a transaction or arrangement; or</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>c</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|79|31:77">
<form.text>A potential ownership or investment interest in, or compensation arrangement with, any entity or individual with which the Organization is negotiating a transaction or arrangement.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|79|31:77">
<form.text>Compensation includes direct and indirect remuneration as well as gifts or favors that are not insubstantial.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|79|31:77">
<form.text>A financial interest is not necessarily a conflict of interest. Under Part III, Section 2 below, a person who has a financial interest may have a conflict of interest only if the appropriate governing board or committee decides that a conflict of interest exists.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>1</designator>
<name>Duty to Disclose</name>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|79|31:77">
<form.text>In connection with any actual or possible conflict of interest, an interested person must disclose the existence of the financial interest and be given the opportunity to disclose all material facts to the directors and members of committees with governing board delegated powers considering the proposed transaction or arrangement.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>2</designator>
<name>Determining Whether a Conflict of Interest Exists</name>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|79|31:77">
<form.text>After disclosure of the financial interest and all material facts and after any discussion with the interested person, he or she shall leave the governing board or committee meeting while the determination of a conflict of interest is discussed and voted upon. The remaining board or committee members shall decide if a conflict of interest exists.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>3</designator>
<name>Procedures for Addressing the Conflict of Interest</name>
</name.block>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>a</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|79|31:77">
<form.text>An interested person may make a presentation at the governing board or committee meeting, but after the presentation he or she shall leave the meeting during the discussion of and the vote on the transaction or arrangement involving the possible conflict of interest.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>b</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|79|31:77">
<form.text>The chairperson of the governing board or committee shall, if appropriate, appoint a disinterested person or committee to investigate alternatives to the proposed transaction or arrangement.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>c</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|79|31:77">
<form.text>After exercising due diligence, the governing board or committee shall determine whether the Organization can obtain, with reasonable efforts, a more advantageous transaction or arrangement from a person or entity that would not give rise to a conflict of interest.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>d</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|79|31:77">
<form.text>If a more advantageous transaction or arrangement is not reasonably possible under circumstances not producing a conflict of interest, the governing board or committee shall determine by a majority vote of the disinterested directors whether the transaction or arrangement is in the Organization's best interest and for its own benefit and whether it is fair and reasonable. In conformity with the above determination, it shall make its decision as to whether to enter into the transaction or arrangement.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>4</designator>
<name>Violations of the Conflicts of Interest Policy</name>
</name.block>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>a</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|79|31:77">
<form.text>If the governing board or committee has reasonable cause to believe a member has failed to disclose actual or possible conflicts of interest, it shall inform the member of the basis for such belief and afford the member an opportunity to explain the alleged failure to disclose.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>b</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|79|31:77">
<form.text>If, after hearing the member's response and after making further investigation as warranted by the circumstances, the governing board or committee determines the member has failed to disclose an actual or possible conflict of interest, it shall take appropriate disciplinary and corrective action.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|79|31:77">
<form.text>The minutes of the governing board and all committees with board delegated powers shall contain:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>a</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|79|31:77">
<form.text>The names of the persons who disclosed or otherwise were found to have a financial interest in connection with an actual or possible conflict of interest, the nature of the financial interest, any action taken to determine whether a conflict of interest was present, and the governing board's or committee's decision as to whether a conflict of interest in fact existed.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>b</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|79|31:77">
<form.text>The names of the persons who were present for discussions and votes relating to the transaction or arrangement, the content of the discussion, including any alternatives to the proposed transaction or arrangement, and a record of any votes taken in connection with the proceedings.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>V</designator>
<name>COMPENSATION</name>
</name.block>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>a</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|79|31:77">
<form.text>A voting member of the governing board who receives compensation, directly or indirectly, from the Organization for services is precluded from voting on matters pertaining to that member's compensation.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>b</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|79|31:77">
<form.text>A voting member of any committee whose jurisdiction includes compensation matters and who receives compensation, directly or indirectly, from the Organization for services is precluded from voting on matters pertaining to that member's compensation.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>c</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|79|31:77">
<form.text>No voting member of the governing board or any committee whose jurisdiction includes compensation matters and who receives compensation, directly or indirectly, from the Organization, either individually or collectively, is prohibited from providing information to any committee regarding compensation.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|79|31:77">
<form.text>Each director, principal officer, and member of a committee with governing board delegated powers shall annually sign a statement which affirms such person:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>a</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|79|31:77">
<form.text>Has received a copy of the conflict of interest policy;</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>b</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|79|31:77">
<form.text>Has read and understands the policy;</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>c</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|79|31:77">
<form.text>Has agreed to comply with the policy; and</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>d</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|79|31:77">
<form.text>Understands the Organization is charitable and in order to maintain its federal tax exemption it must engage primarily in activities that accomplish one or more of its tax-exempt purposes.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|79|31:77">
<form.text>To ensure the Organization operates in a manner consistent with charitable purposes and does not engage in activities that could jeopardize its tax-exempt status, periodic reviews shall be conducted. The periodic reviews shall, at a minimum, include the following subjects:</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.unit>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>a</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|79|31:77">
<form.text>Whether compensation arrangements and benefits are reasonable, based on competent survey information, and the result of arm's length bargaining.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<name.block>
<designator>b</designator>
</name.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|79|31:77">
<form.text>Whether partnerships, joint ventures, and arrangements with management organizations conform to the Organization's written policies; are properly recorded; reflect reasonable investment or payments for goods and services; further charitable purposes; and do not result in inurement, impermissible private benefit, or in an excess benefit transaction.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
</form.item>
<form.item>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|79|31:77">
<form.text>When conducting the periodic reviews as provided for in Part VII, the Organization may, but need not, use outside advisors. If outside experts are used, their use shall not relieve the governing board of its responsibility for ensuring periodic reviews are conducted.</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|79|31:77">
<form.text>Adopted by the Board of Directors: <inline.instr>__lsqb__date of adoption__rsqb__</inline.instr>.</form.text>
</form.para>
</form.item>
</form.unit>
<note.block>
<note.group note.head="none">
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|79|31:77">
<para.text>
An “excess benefit transaction” is a transaction in which an economic benefit is provided by an exempt organization to a disqualified person in excess of the consideration received. <st>26 U.S.C.A. &sect;4958(c)(1)</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|79|31:77">
<para.text>
A “disqualified person” is someone who, during the five years preceding the transaction, was in a position to exercise substantial influence over the affairs of the organization. Disqualified persons also include family members and certain entities in which at least 35% of the control or beneficial interest are held by persons described in the preceding sentence. <st>26 U.S.C.A. &sect;4958(f)(1)</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
<para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|79|31:77">
<para.text>
Initially, the person receiving the benefit must pay a tax of 25% of the amount of the excess benefit. If not corrected within the prescribed period, the person must then pay a tax of 200% of the excess benefit. In addition, an organization manager who knowingly participates in the excess benefit transaction must pay a tax of 10% of the excess benefit. The maximum amount of this final tax is limited to $20,000. Persons liable for these taxes must file a Form 4720. See <st>26 C.F.R. &sect;53.6011-1(b)</st>.
</para.text>
</para>
</note.group>
<research.reference.block>
<reference.entry><ref.text><tk>West's Key Number Digest, Internal Revenue &key;4045 to 4079</tk></ref.text></reference.entry>
<reference.entry date.trace="1"><ref.text>Excise taxes on excess benefit transactions, <rc>Federal Tax Coordinator 2d (RIA) &dblpara;D-6650 et seq</rc>.</ref.text></reference.entry>
</research.reference.block>
</note.block>
</form>
</section.body>
</section>
<section>
<section.front>
<outline.name.block>

<designator>31:78</designator>
<name>Conflict of interest acknowledgment and disclosure</name>
</outline.name.block>
<online.view>

</online.view>
</section.front>
<section.body>
<form uuid="Ic70d9ac0181b11e68c12afa7f3a24041">
<form.name.block>
<name>CONFLICT OF INTEREST ACKNOWLEDGMENT AND DISCLOSURE FORM</name>
</form.name.block>
<form.line align="l">
</form.line>
<signature.block ref="manual">
<signature.group position="r">
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
</signature.group>
</signature.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|80|31:78">
<form.text>
I have read and received the conflict of interest policy set forth above and agree to comply fully with its terms and conditions at all times during my service as a <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__specification of role__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr> of <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__name of organization__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr>. If at any time following the submission of this form I become aware of any actual or potential conflicts of interest, or if the information provided below becomes inaccurate or incomplete, I will promptly notify the <inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__name of organization__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr> Board of Directors in writing.
</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.line align="l">
</form.line>
<signature.block ref="manual">
<signature.group position="r">
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
</signature.group>
</signature.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|80|31:78">
<form.text>
<inline.instr><inline.instr>__lsqb__Specification of conflict of interest__rsqb__</inline.instr></inline.instr>.
</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.line align="l">
</form.line>
<signature.block ref="manual">
<signature.group position="r">
<form.vertical.space amt="1"/>
</signature.group>
</signature.block>
<form.para ct.id="f477b8b0b92511efa86bc22ba615bad8|80|31:78">
<form.text>
I hereby certify that the information set forth above is true and complete to the best of my knowledge.
</form.text>
</form.para>
<form.line align="l">
</form.line>
<signature.block ref="manual">
<signature.group position="r">

</form.line>
</signature.group>
</signature.block>

</para.text>
